results.description:
I had to cover a lot... so please read all the text below.

Here's a video to get you started. Don't let the length intimidate you. Just focus on the first few minutes but do as much as you like.


http://youtu.be/aV8dS2m9Adc

I'm really excited about this event. I've been working on this for a few months... 2 Hanson Rec Commission meetings later, increasing my liability insurance, signing my life away in a contract, approval from the town administrator and what seems to be 50 trips to this place. I have permission for us to do a series of Beginner Salsa Lessons. (swing lessons to follow if this is a success) I'll post 2 to start so please help me make these a success by giving it a shot. You'll have a blast trust me!


Our instructors have years of dancing experience, plenty of personality and of course I'll be providing the sound system with some great music. I've taken group lessons before and the music was too fast, esp in the open dance time. So we're going to gear this to 2 left footed neanderthal dancers like me.


The Hanson Rec Commission members are very excited about this and want us to succeed. So thank them when you see them at the event.


Our plan is to have weekly dances for 2 hours. The first hour will be a lesson and the 2nd an open dance. These will be geared for beginners so don't be afraid. To You Salsa veterans - please come because we'll need your help too... and you can show off during the open dance hour.


Once per month we'll be having a bartender for a 4 hour dance. A little wine might loosen up the hips a little ;-) This first dance will be for 2 hours. The 2nd dance lesson on Feb 26th will have the bar and be open for 4 hours. (7-11 see the post for the 26th)


Gender equity? of course ladies bring a man with you but for the first few lessons gender equity won't be a huge issue. Nevertheless, put the pressure on the men you know, in the group and out, to make it to this. It's gonna be a blast !

Please post questions below.

DIRECTIONS - Please use your GPS. For those of you who have never been, Hanson is only 30 min from Plymouth and Braintree. And only 15 min from Hanover or Brockton. See it's nice and centrally located. Camp Kiwannee is right on rt 58 with plenty of parking.

The cost is $10 per person - a very reasonable price. FYI - I don't make a dime on this. Camp Kiwanee gets a percentage of the door and the remainder goes to the instructors and those working the door.


Here's a few pictures of Needles Lodge at Camp Kiwanee. It's a gem right here in our little one-horse town of Hanson.

That's only about 2/3rds of the room. They were rehearsing a play in the other third. I'll get better pictures up there soon. But you get the idea.

the entrance... love this place... Old world charm...

Come join us for our May meetup. Get travel ideas from fellow travelers, and share your own travel stories! 

QUESTION FOR MAY: Where did you experience the best cultural immersion?


Our concept is simple: meet other travelers or expats, chat about where you've been and where they've been, and get inspired for your next trip. Everyone with an open mind and sense of adventure is welcome, whether you're a travel novice or an experienced travel junkie. 

This month we'll meet at Tavern in the Square @ Porter Sq. This is a very accessible location; There is parking close by, and it's literally a 1 min walk from the T (red-line) - just exit the T station and walk down Mass Ave, away from the big Porter Sq parking lot. There are lots of convenient bus connections too. We'll be in the front area, to the right of the bar.

Each month, we generally switch back and forth between Porter Square and White Horse Tavern in Allston. We're also considering future options in other neighborhoods - suggestions are welcome!

Please note: Active solicitation of members at our meetups by commercial organizations is contrary to the spirit of the group. Please stay away if you are a travel company just looking to promote your business! Thank you!

results.description:
RSVP here at Eventbrite: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/me-want-it-but-me-wait-defining-measuring-and-improving-self-regulation-in-early-childhood-registration-24972007948

Me Want it, But Me Wait: Defining, Measuring, and Improving Self-Regulation in Early Childhood

In an increasingly complex and stimulating world, how do children learn to control their impulses and avoid distraction? Using evidence from neuroscience, developmental psychology, and education, this talk will explore the importance of self-regulation and executive function as core skills to be developed in the preschool period. In particular, we will consider what it means to be "well regulated," how we can measure this abstract construct in real-world settings, and what environmental and biological factors might improve -- or inhibit -- children's odds of achieving self-regulatory success.

Speaker Bio: Dana Charles McCoy is an assistant professor at the Harvard Graduate School of Education. Her work focuses on understanding the ways that poverty-related risk factors in children's home, school, and neighborhood environments affect the development of their cognitive and socioemotional skills in early childhood. She is also interested in the development, refinement, and evaluation of early intervention programs designed to promote positive development and resilience in young children, particularly in terms of their self-regulation and executive function. Dr. McCoy's work is centered in both domestic and international contexts, including Ghana, Tanzania, Zambia, Brazil, and Jordan. She has a particular interest in interdisciplinary theory, causal methodology, and ecologically valid measurement. Before joining the HGSE faculty, Dr. McCoy served as an NICHD National Research Service Award post-doctoral fellow at the Harvard Center on the Developing Child, where she studied differential effectiveness of early childhood education programs (e.g., Head Start) across diverse communities in the United States. She graduated with an A.B. in Psychological and Brain Sciences from Dartmouth College and received her Ph.D. in Applied Psychology from New York University.

Directions to Le Laboratoire Cambridge, 650 East Kendall Street Public Transit: Red line to Kendall Square, walk straight down 3rd Street, turn right onto Athenaeum Street, and left onto East Kendall Parking: There is a parking deck - the 650 East Kendall Street Garage - accessible by Linskey Way.


If you purchase food or drink from Le Lab, your parking ticket can be validated for discounted rates.

results.description:
Comic Summary: 

Every summer, Rose goes with her mom and dad to a lake house in Awago Beach. It's their getaway, their refuge. Rosie's friend Windy is always there, too, like the little sister she never had. But this summer is different. Rose's mom and dad won't stop fighting, and when Rose and Windy seek a distraction from the drama, they find themselves with a whole new set of problems. One of the local teens - just a couple of years older than Rose and Windy - is caught up in something bad... Something life threatening.

It's a summer of secrets, and sorrow, and growing up, and it's a good thing Rose and Windy have each other.

Venue/Time: Framingham Beer Works, Tuesday May 17 @ 7pm

results.description:
Join Dharma teacher Brendan Kennedy in person or via LiveStream (http://www.naturaldharma.org/live-teachings/) at Cambridge Friends Meeting House on Tuesday May 17th.

Brendan Kennedy has been practicing Tibetan Buddhism for over 30 years. His main teachers are: His Holiness the Dalai Lama, Dilgo Khyentse Rinpoche, Chatral Rinpoche, Sokste Rinpoche and Lama Surya Das. Drawing on his deep study of Ramana Maharishi and Nisagardatta Maharaji, Brendan illuminates the complementary similarities between Dzogchen and Avaita Vedanta through experiential teaching. Brendan gives a few intensive retreats each year, but primarily focuses on synthesizing theory and practice at his desert hermitage in California.

More details and information about our group can be found at the following URL:

http://www.naturaldharma.org

Please note: most of the friends who attend regularly are not Meetup members, so there are always more people attending than are signed up using this web site.

results.description:
Do you know the purpose, cause, or belief that inspires you to do what you do?

The most frequent greeting at a networking meeting is the question, “What do you do?” But, giving your job title is the wrong answer. People don’t choose to work with you, because of what you do. They will choose you because of how they connect with you. YOUR STORY, offered up in a concise, compelling manner, is your secret sauce. People connect with a good story – especially if you tell your “why.” In this 2 hour workshop, led by publisher and promotion expert, Jenny Hudson, (http://merrimackmedia.com) everyone will be able to share and develop their why stories. She will personally coach a couple of participants while Mike Connel will shoot video. YOUR WHY STORY IS THE BASIS FOR YOUR COMPELLING BIO, VIDEO, AND BOOK. Get some great take-aways for telling your story. Have a glass of wine or beer and a light snack and enjoy.


Reservations required.

Jenny Hudson, owner of Merrimack Media, http://merrimackmedia.com, and Create Publish, & Promote, http://www.create-publish-promote.com, helps you articulate your unique experience and translate it into a compelling bio, video, and content for a book and much more. As owner of a self-publishing company, she can get you published and promoted, with individualized marketing strategy.

Mike Connell is a Video Producer and Video Marketer. He owns KC Visuals Unlimited, Inc. and its subsidiary HBSU or Home & Business Services Unlimited and has produced video professionally since 1980, providing businesses with video for marketing, training, and promotion.
results.name: Your Killer Bio, now Staring YOU in Video

results.description:
Animators and Artists, join us for a fun and valuable talk!

You may have noticed that many businesses, medical companies, non-profits and educational groups hire animators to tell their stories, helping to explain sometimes-complicated concepts in engaging and funny ways. Cambridge studio Planet Nutshell is the best of the best at telling these stories. Lucky for us, they’re coming to the Armory to talk all about how they work with clients, and how they combine great design, crisp animation and a little bit of magic to set their work apart from the rest. Many animators will find themselves working on similar projects in the coming years, so we hope you’ll join us to learn from the masters!

AniMAtic Boston also provides a great chance to meet other talented members of the Boston animation community, chat about what’s going on in the industry, what you’re inspired by, and anything else on your mind.

Don’t miss out!

Doors open at 7pm, Talk starts at 7:30pm

Event is open to all, with a suggested donation of $5. Beer and wine will be available, and there’s a cafe right downstairs if you want to grab a meal and bring it up. 

Believe it or not, there’s parking too! A free parking lot located behind the Armory.
results.name: Join us on May 17 for a great talk from Planet Nutshell on Business Animation

results.description:
Cultivating Healthy Relationships                                                                                                     a meditation class series 

TUESDAYS | May 10th - June 14th


7:00 - 8:30pm

Relationships are a work in progress, so just imagine if all your relationships were free from conflict and deeply satisfying. Finding the right mental attitude is the key to making this happen. Without a fundamental shift in our views, we will continue to be stuck in our well-worn relationship patterns.

In this drop-in class series, we will learn how to distinguish between what love is – and what it isn’t. We will see how letting go of the mind of attachment can transform our bad relationships into good ones. And how it can make our good relationships even better! 

Each class is beginner friendly- feel free to drop-in to any class in the series or try to attend each one! No need to pre-register. 

with Kadampa Buddhist Teacher, Kyle Davis


Cost | $10 per class / $5 students & seniors.  Members FREE! 

Location | 179 Green Street – Boston, Jamaica Plain, MA 02130  

meditationINboston.org

results.description:
Meditation practice gives us a chance to step away from the busy-ness of our day-to-day lives. It provides space for us to be free from reaction, from expectation, from doing, and step into the gentle space of being.

This weekly practice consists of 25-30 minutes of guided Vipassana meditation followed by a brief discussion. Vipassana meditation encourages us to experience each moment exactly how it is, fostering presence and awareness.

In this practice we allow thoughts, emotions, and all other stimuli to surface. We become a witness of these, cultivating a space of non-attachment and revealing a deeper connection with one's inner self.

Newcomers to meditation and long-time practitioners are welcome to attend. This is a FREE practice. There is a suggested donation, but that is not required to attend.

results.description:
Awaken the Healing Power within Your Body and Mind

· Awaken your body and mind’s innate healing power

· Develop healthier and more fulfilling relationships

· Learn to work constructively with your own emotions

· Stimulate your minds innate problem solving capabilities

· Develop new resources and capabilities

· Become clear about your life’s purpose

Our bodies communicate with us all the time. Many of us are so over stimulated and stressed out that we cannot hear what our bodies are saying. We age faster and suffer many health problems when we do not know how to listen to what our body is telling us.

Discover the amazing wisdom that resides within your own body. Ben will show you how to develop your sensory awareness. Learn to truly listen to your body and care for its needs.

Stimulate the mind's creative problem solving capabilities by learning to "digest" issues, emotions and stresses

Many of us have never learned how to work with difficult issues and emotions. We tend to push these things down inside of ourselves. Undigested thoughts, issues, emotions and the stresses of daily life create a residue that accumulates within the tissues and organs of our bodies. That creates a great deal of additional stress upon our body and mind. These stresses can arrest our process of development, disconnect us from the divine creative intelligence of the universe and shut down our intuition. It also causes our bodies break down at a more rapid pace and that accelerates the aging process.

Learn to use your body-mind's innate healing power to "digest and assimilate" your thoughts feelings, emotions, issues and life experiences. You will begin to release the stresses that are held within the body and to heal the painful emotions associated with anxiety, depression and emotionally traumatic experiences. You will also learn to go right to the source of the issues to bring about a resolution that allows you to really move forward in your life.

Working with these practices helps to increase your intellectual and emotional range, improve memory, initiate new cycles of growth, awaken inner passions, spark creativity and deepen intuition. You will develop the strength and resilience that will make it easier for you to adapt to the demands that life places upon you.

Discover the passion and power that resides within you

Chinese Martial Arts Masters emphasize the development of a base of power known as the "dan tien". The stress of living in such a fast paced world can cause us to disconnect from our foundation. Undigested food, emotions and the stresses of daily life begin to accumulate within the abdomen. We may experience bloating and suffer from various digestive problems. Some of us begin to lose touch with our drive, passion, inspiration and the sense of knowing that reveals our true purpose as our instinctual base shuts down.

You will learn to become fully present within your body, to develop greater personal power, and to awaken the inner passion and sense of knowing that will bring give you a greater sense of clarity about your life's purpose.

Activate the healing intelligence that resides within the body and mind

We all have a powerful healing intelligence that resides within our bodies and minds. This innate healing power helps to mend our bodies any time we suffer an illness or injury. Our innate healing powers are often compromised by the stress and toxins that accumulate within our bodies.

Learn to activate the generative healing powers that reside within your own body and mind. Awaken the consciousness of the individual organs. Access and heal the emotions and core issues that are held within the body. These practices are very effective for healing digestive and respiratory disorders and a wide range of other health issues.

Alternate Tuesdays at 7:30 PM at Unity of Somerville, located at 6 William Street at the corner of College Avenue

Call (913)[masked] to learn more

Ben was drawn to indigenous cultures from an early age and found himself living among the Kiowa Tribe in Oklahoma at the age of seventeen. He began his training with Horace Daukei, the last surviving traditional doctor (medicine man) among the Kiowa Tribe. Ben went on to study with Chinese Master Li Tai Liang. He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.

Please go to http://www.doiohm.com... or call (913)[masked] for more information

results.description:
• Heal the emotional wounds of past relationships
• Transform deep seated patterns of abandonment and rejection
• Let go of unhealthy dysfunctional relationships
• Develop the ability to remain centered in the core of your being
• Become truly loving and accepting of yourself
• Develop a warm magnetic presence that will draw others to you
• Cultivate inner beauty
• Increase your capacity to give and receive love
• Attract a healthy and loving partner
• Create healthier and more fulfilling relationships
• Develop a stronger connection with the higher power
• Learn to evolve spiritually through your relationships


My friend Sema was telling me about how she had fallen for a man, but he had not called her in some time. Sema told me that she felt this man would come back to her somewhere down the road. Yet she also acknowledged that on another level she was experiencing a fear of loss and that she didn’t feel that there was much hope for the relationship. Sema told me later that evening that she could never seem to hold onto the men that she truly wanted to be with.

Sema was obviously strung out on the man, but she was very disconnected from the underlying pain that was driving her. Sema’s head was just spinning in circles as she analyzed everything the man said or did and why he wasn’t with her at that time. I could see that the hurt buried within Sema was keeping her attached to the man in a very unhealthy way…

Does this sound familiar?

Many of us are struggling to find love. But no matter what we do, love always seems to evade us.

I’ve been there myself and I didn’t know if I would ever find the love that I desired. But I persevered because I was very determined to heal and have someone special in my life. I discovered a series of practices that have enabled me to heal the emotional wounds and to develop a magnetic presence. These practices are making it possible for me to attract more loving partners and to create healthier and more fulfilling relationships. I have now decided to share these practices and understandings so that others can also create more love and intimacy and to attract someone truly special.

Open Your Heart by Healing the Emotional Wounds That Carry Over From Childhood and Past Loves
Most of us are still carrying the emotional wounds from our childhood and our past loves. We try to block the hurtful feelings and memories out of our awareness. But these feelings and experiences remain trapped within our body and mind. We then give off a vibe that causes us to attract and become attracted to dysfunctional people who create even more confusion, pain and suffering in our lives.

Learn to “digest” the emotional baggage that keeps you trapped in unfulfilling relationships. Transform the deep seated patterns that cause you to attract people who are negative or abusive or who do not have the capacity to truly love you and be present with you.

Heal the loss of past loves. Heal the shame and the feelings unworthiness, rejection and abandonment. Become clearer about what you really want in life and in a companion. You will naturally attract and find yourself attracted to healthier people as you heal the wounded parts of yourself. More and more love will flow to you as you begin to experience true love and acceptance for yourself. Working with these practices will make it possible for you to cultivate inner beauty and to develop a presence that is very healing to others.

Develop the Kind of Warm Magnetic Presence That Will Attract a Healthy and Loving Partner
Many of us have learned to disconnect from our emotions and are not very present within our bodies. The stresses, emotions and life experiences that we fail to digest accumulate within our body and mind. These stagnant energies and emotions can extinguish our inner fire and passion. Stagnant energies decrease our desirability which makes us less attractive to others.

A body that if full of vital life force is infinitely more desirable. Become powerfully present while remaining centered within the core of your being. Exude warmth, passion, sensuality and desire.

Develop Your Intuition and Sensory Awareness
Heightened intuition and sensory awareness lets us know when it is safe for us to open up to another person. It helps us to understand where people are coming from. Our intuition also guides us to the people that we are meant to be with.

Use Your Relationships to Evolve Spiritually
Healing the hurts and resolving the issues awakens the part of the soul that resides within your body. Awakening your body-mind will enable you to develop a stronger connection with your higher self and the universal consciousness.

Develop Chi Power
Many systems of Chinese martial arts emphasize the development of the dan tien, which is our base of power in the lower abdomen. You will learn specific chi gong practices that will enable you to continually cultivate the chi/shakthi in the dan tien. Developing Chi Power enables you to create a powerful magnetic presence that draws others to you.

Create Healthier and More Fulfilling Relationships
Relationships have a way of bringing our core issues to the surface. Buried emotions and unresolved issues create barriers between ourselves and others. Our love grows stronger and our understanding deepens as we learn to “digest” our emotions, resolve important issues and express our feelings and needs in a healthy way.

Ben was drawn to indigenous cultures from an early age and found himself living among the Kiowa Tribe in Oklahoma at the age of seventeen. He began his training with Horace Daukei, the last surviving traditional doctor (medicine man) among the Kiowa Tribe. Ben went on to study with Chinese Master Li Tai Liang. He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.


Please go to http://www.doiohm.com... or call (913)[masked] for more information

I'm working out in the field much of the time. I have very limited access to the internet and that can make it difficult for me to respond to emails. Please call me at (913)[masked] if you have any questions and are interested in attending. I will be happy to answer any questions that you have about how you can heal from the loss of a love and develop a more attractive presence. Let me know in advance about your individual needs and concerns and we will address these issues during class.

Please go to http://www.facebook.com/healthyandlovingrelationships and click on the LIKE button at the top of the page to join the community and gain access to new articles.

Contact me if you have questions.

  Reiki Share Agenda

• The 1st 15 minutes of each share we will have time to connect with friends and introduce new members, allowing time to center and prepare for our Reiki sessions.

• It is our goal that each practitioner will have the opportunity to relish in 20 to 30 minutes of Reiki; dependent on how many practitioners are present for the share. 

• We will make every effort to synchronize each session allowing for the highest healing good of each person.

• Quiet discussion of the sessions may be shared quietly while your group is preparing for the next person.

• The room will be available at the conclusion of the Reiki Share so that you can socialize, give feedback and network with like-minded friends.

  Reiki Share Guidelines

• RSVP so that we may plan for adequate space and tables.

• Arrive on time, this allows time to center and enjoy the evening in a stress free manner.

• Please silence or turn off cell/mobile phones.

• During the share please be respectful of other groups enjoying Reiki by keeping conversations to a whisper and as brief as possible.  There will be ample time at the end of the evening for comments and discussions.

• If arriving late to the share, please enter the room "quietly" so the active session is not disturbed.  You may spend time in quite mediation, preparing for Reiki or enjoying self Reiki joining a group when the monument presents itself.  

Donations will be collected to offset the cost of the room.

We are meeting every Tuesday night from 8:00 PM to 10:00 PM practicing Modern Arnis, WC, and SCJ flow drills and Self-Defense skills.

All levels are welcome!  For ages 15 and up.


The price is $15.00 /per person /per meetup. The first meetup is free.

Please wear loose fitting, comfortable cloths suitable for working out.

Please do not wear shoes that you've worn outdoors on the wood floor.



Instructor's Background

Alix Lavaud has been training Martial Arts for over 45 years and is a master of Modern Arnis, Pien San Wing Chun Kung Fu, and has extensive training in Small Circle Jujitsu.  He also humbly owns the rank of Lakan Apat (a 4th degree BLACKBELT ).


Lineage

Modern Arnis :  Remy Presas  -->  Alix Lavaud

Wing Chun:  Henry Mui  -->  Alix Lavaud

Small Circle Jujitsu:  Wally Jay -->  Alix Lavaud


Philosophy

 Go With The Flow ...

Some Quotes we Love

“If your mind is empty, it is ready for anything. In the beginner’s mind there are many possibilities, but in the expert’s there are few”
― Shunryu Suzuki


“Everything is perfect and there is always room for improvement.”
― Shunryu Suzuki

“We must exist right here and right now!”
― Shunryu Suzuki

Benefits of Martial Arts

1.  Mental Benefits

2.  Improved Balance

3.  Improved Flexibility

4.  Focus and stillness

5.  Hand and Eye Coordination

6.  Improved reflexes

7.  Learn self-defense skills

8.  Stress relief

9.  Relax

10.  Gain Self Confident and Self Respect

11.  Learn to Breathe

12.  Learn to Find Focus and Stillness

13.  Encouraging Non-Violent Conflict Resolution

14.  Improvement in many other Areas of Life

results.description:
Ongoing class in Medieval and Renaissance Longsword in the tradition of Johannes Lichtenauer.


The Longsword is the iconic fantasy Knight's sword - a two-handed, straight blade with a cross guard. The weapon may seem to be simple at first but is in reality a weapon of finesse and skill.


The class covers all the basics of footwork, attacks and defenses. Drills are developed from simple to complex; from rigidly choreographed to open-ended. Timing, distance and judgement are developed.


All classes begin with a Strength & Conditioning program designed to physically prepare one for fighting with the sword. Elements develop agility, core stability and power.

</a>

<a href="https://www.innerengineering.com/">Inner Engineering is a resource that can help with your self-help and self-improvement journey whether you are a veteran or a beginner. Sadhguru, a yogi and mystic, and one of the foremost authorities on yoga, offers his characteristically pragmatic wisdom for a life of joy and fulfillment. Starting with four basic dimensions of the self –Body, Mind, Emotions, and Energy – Sadhguru introduces us to simple techniques to realign and transform them into a life of sparkling aliveness.

Inner Engineering is a method of enhancing yourself and emerging into the ideal way you want to be. It is a 7-session online course that provides tools and solutions to empower yourself to create your life the way you want it. It gives you the opportunity to intellectually explore the ABC’s of life using methods from the distilled essence of yogic sciences. The course provides a simple, easy to use, proven methods to empower yourself for self-empowerment.

This 1 hour introduction to Inner Engineering explains the fundamental approach of the program in a live setting that offers you the opportunity to ask a trained Isha teacher questions about the program and practices available.

“Inner Engineering is neither a religion, nor a philosophy or dogma; It is a technology for wellbeing. One does not have to believe or disbelieve, you just have to learn to use it. Technology will produce results irrespective of who you are.” – Sadhguru

results.description:
YOU MUST REGISTER HERE ON EVENTBRITE TO ATTEND: http://devlab-boston-2016.eventbrite.com/?aff=muhtml

(**Be sure to register today since there will be limited seating..)

  See why over 3,000 developers across the country have attended AT&T DevLabs! Have you heard about WebRTC? Do you want to try it out? Now’s your chance!

Join the AT&T Developer Program as we bring the highly successful, free AT&T WebRTC Coding Workshops to Boston. 


WebRTC is an API drafted by the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) that, in addition to supporting calling and conferencing apps, allows voice, video communications, and P2P file sharing to easily be added to any web app. Analysts agree that it is one of the most disruptive telecommunications technologies to hit the street in years.

These are not marketing pitches, but rather 3-hour, hands-on coding workshops taught by AT&T's lead architect for WebRTC. He will walk you through various coding examples, then AT&T experts will provide help as you go through the lab exercises yourself.

An extra perk? Attendees will be entered in a drawing for an Acer Chromebook!

There are afternoon and evening sessions – same content – so choose the one that is most convenient for you. Then bring your Windows or Mac laptop and join us for an afternoon or evening of learning, coding, socializing, and eating!

What people are saying about the AT&T DevLabs: 

"I walked out of there feeling like an API rockstar."


Schedule (both sessions have the same content):

Afternoon session: 

12:00 p.m. - 1:00 p.m.                  Registration & lunch


1:00 p.m. - 4:00 p.m.                   AT&T WebRTC Coding Workshop

Evening Session:

5:00 p.m. - 6:00 p.m.                  Registration & dinner

6:00 p.m. - 9:00 p.m.                  AT&T WebRTC Coding Workshop

This is a joint event being organized by the AT&T Developer Programs, along with media partners Boston New Technology, and Girl Develop It... 

Registration: 

http://devlab-boston-2016.eventbrite.com/?aff=muhtml

Where: 

Metro Meeting Centers, 101 Federal Street, Boston, MA 02110

Additional Info:

The event is free and we will be serving lunch or dinner. 

Stay up-to-date on future AT&T events by joining the AT&T Boston Coding Workshops & Hackathons meetup.

Venue

DevLab is being held at the Metro Meeting Centers-Boston, located in the heart of downtown Boston's financial district and is easily accessible via public transportation (MBTA Red, Green, Orange, Blue, and Silver Lines; Amtrak Trains; Bus Lines) or by auto.

Pictures from last year's Boston DevLabs


*** All attendees are expected to abide by the Girl Develop It Code of Conduct. 



Technical Details for Lab Exercises (please set up Node.js and Chrome ahead of time - links are listed below)

Note that only Mac OS and Windows are supported during the DevLab.

Technology:

 Node.js (v0.10.x or later. Install it as Admin)

 Development Machine:

 Windows 7 or later (Preferred Windows 8.1)

 OR

 Mac OS X (Lion or later)

Development Environment:

 A text editor

Browser:

 Chrome v41 or later

Connectivity:

 A user’s browser should be able to:

* Send/receive HTTPS traffic to/from https://api.att.com

* Send/receive UDP media traffic. (Test your Browser and          Network readiness here: https://test.webrtc.org)
results.name: AT&T Free WebRTC Coding Workshops, May 18, Boston: w Bos New Tech & Girl Dvlp It

results.description:
Register for Free at http://bit.ly/1Sfv64t  (Required to attend)

WebRTC provides browsers, mobile applications and IoT devices with optimized Real-Time Communications (RTC) capabilities (audio & video). Have you heard about WebRTC? Do you want to try it out? Now’s your chance! Join the AT&T Developer Program for a free coding workshop on the AT&T Enhanced WebRTC API.


See why over 3,000 developers across the country have attended AT&T DevLabs!

Please Pre-Register Here Before Spots Run Out! (Required to Attend)


These are not marketing pitches, but rather 3-hour, hands-on coding workshops taught by AT&T's lead architect for WebRTC. He will walk you through various coding examples then AT&T experts will provide help as you go through the lab exercises yourself. 

Analysts agree that WebRTC is one of the most disruptive telecommunications technologies to hit the street in years. The reason: WebRTC is not just about calling and conferencing apps, though it does those well. The real power is that it allows voice and video communications to easily be added to any web app. Just think of how that could increase the customer engagement of your applications.

An extra perk? Attendees will be entered in a drawing for an Acer Chromebook!

The workshops will focus on a carrier-agnostic version of the AT&T WebRTC API and will work with any web app running in Chrome. So come to the workshop to learn this exciting technology, network with AT&T experts and your fellow developers, and have some fun!

"I walked out of there feeling like an API rockstar."


Register for either the afternoon or evening session (same content) on May 18th!


Afternoon session with lunch: 12 – 4 p.m. (registration & lunch 12 – 1, workshop 1 – 4)

Evening session with dinner: 5 – 9 p.m. (registration & lunch 5 – 6, workshop 6 – 9)

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball. 

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.

results.description:
Do you VEGETABLE-TARIANS want all the OTHER people (even if they have not committed to be vegetarians) to eat fresh produce?  Then help us - each Wednesday late afternoon - bag vegetables (and some fruit) for the neighbors in Mission Hill.  Usually there are also freshly-baked loaves of bread, also (baked that morning - Jessica's Bakery).

It's an assembly line, then take home a bag (or two) of produce for yourself. 


Bring your business cards, smartphone, or notepad, and prepare to exchange contact info with other volunteers you like.  Volunteers come from several sources (not merely this meetup or others:Craigslist, Pharmacy School, School of Public Health, etc.) 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
VOLUNTEERING for $2/bag of produce in Mission Hill
Tobin Community Center, 1481 Tremont Street
Mission Hill, Roxbury
(between Brigham Circle and Roxbury Crossing T stops)
Boston, MA 02120 - <2 blocks from Orange Line T Each Wednesday, from 4:00 - 6:00 pm (indoors in bad weather)

We will be VOLUNTEERING for the weekly Wednesday late afternoon $2/bag of produce in Mission Hill.

When you volunteer,
YOU will ALSO TAKE HOME one or two of those "$2 bags"!
We've had 55 volunteers, and we've had 7.  Workloads vary!

Fair Foods provides a 20-22 bag of produce for the Mission Hill neighbors so they can eat like me - on produce. The neighbors only need to pay' $2 for the bag.

Volunteers unload the truck, set up 3 banquet tables, set up the food in order of desntiy (potatoes on bottom - tomatoes and bananas and berries and kale on top), then fill each bag (and 'stack' them upright by one another - for the 'paying neighbors' to pick up (for $2).


We arrive around 4 pm (maybe as late as 4:30 pm) and work until 6 pm (can leave as early as 5:30 pm if we've finished).

In the FRONT of the Tobin Community Center, 1481 Tremont Street (between the Brigham Circle T stop - GREEN E-Line - and the Roxbury Crossing Orange Line T stop), behind the wrought iron fence.

Wear comfortable clothing that allows you to move flexibly and to actually work, lifting heavy bags of food. 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 
Tobin Community Center 
1481 Tremont Street, Boston, MA

THERE IS NO PARKING - IT'S BEST FOR THOSE WHO LIVE IN BOSTON AND TRAVEL IN ON THE MBTA

THERE IS NO PARKING IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD

Every Wednesday, from 4:00 - 6:00 pm 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 
Bring friends!  Forward the invitation to others!

Invite FRIENDS through the Facebook, LinkedIn, and Twitter 'share'
buttons
http://www.yelp.com/events/boston-volunteering-for-2-bag-of-produce-in-mission-hill-each-wednesday-afternoon-from-4-6-pm-at-tobin-community-center

Looking for an ARTIST to help VISUALLY REPRESENT this vegetable outreach effort. 
TALK with us FIRST !!

Looking for Gifted Marketers to 
(i) conceptualize the WHY of low cost vegetable distribution! and 
(ii) the desirability of TAKING the low cost vegetables !!

LOGISTICAL CHALLENGE IS TO GET LOW COST VEGETABLES to the REFRIGERATORS of LOCAL RESIDENTS !!!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 
Vegan Cooking classes or Vegan Cooking Ideas

Vegan Cooking Classes or  
Learning How to Prepare Vegan Food
(using the $2 bag of produce as a low-cost start) 


What Can You Do With Your $2 Bag?

Portion Control

Bake...Don't Fry!

Roasted Veggie Stackers

No-Guilt Banana Ice Cream

Avocados!!!

Salad with Chipotle Hummus

Simple Cilantro Chutney

More $2 bags of Produce!

Drink your greens!
results.name: VOLUNTEERING for distributing $2/bag of produce in Mission Hill

Free Registration Required to Attend: 
http://devlab-boston-2016.eventbrite.com/?aff=muade1

WebRTC (Web Real-Time Communication) is an API definition that supports browser-to-browser applications for voice calling, video chat, and P2P file sharing without the need for either internal or external plugins.

Join AT&T’s lead architect for WebRTC on May 18th for a free 3-hour, hands-on WebRTC workshop.

Walk through  coding examples and then AT&T subject matter experts will provide help as you go through the lab exercises yourself. The workshop focuses on a carrier-agnostic version of the AT&T API and will work with any web app running in Chrome.

This event is free and complimentary lunch or dinner will be provided.

Bring your Windows or Mac laptop and join us for an afternoon or evening of learning, coding, socializing, and eating!

Seating is very limited so sign up soon!

Register here: http://devlab-boston-2016.eventbrite.com/?aff=muade1

results.description:
YOU MUST REGISTER HERE : http://devlab-boston-2016.eventbrite.com/?aff=mugdi   

Have you heard about WebRTC? Do you want to try it out? Now’s your chance! 

Join the AT&T Developer Program, in partnership with Girl Develop It Boston, as we bring the highly successful, free AT&T WebRTC Coding Workshops to Boston. 

WebRTC is an API drafted by the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) that, in addition to supporting calling and conferencing apps, allows voice, video communications, and P2P file sharing to easily be added to any web app. Analysts agree that it is one of the most disruptive telecommunications technologies to hit the street in years.


These are not marketing pitches, but rather 3-hour, hands-on coding workshops taught by AT&T's lead architect for WebRTC. He will walk you through various coding examples, then AT&T experts will provide help as you go through the lab exercises yourself. 

DOES THAT SOUND INTIMIDATING?  Well, have no fear! You do not need any programming experience to attend. All attendees are given a step-by-step instruction booklet to work through and plenty of help from on-site technical experts.


---------> SIGN UP FOR THE WORKSHOP HERE <---------

So bring your Windows or Mac laptop and join AT&T and GDI for an evening of learning, coding, socializing, and eating! 

An extra perk? Attendees will be entered in a drawing for an Acer Chromebook!


The event is free and we will be serving dinner. 

We look forward to seeing you!


Schedule:

5:00 p.m. – 6:00 p.m. Registration & Dinner

6:00 p.m. – 9:00 p.m. AT&T WebRTC Coding Workshop 

If this time doesn't work for you, sign up for the afternoon session! The content of the afternoon and evening sessions are the same.

All attendees are expected to abide by the Girl Develop It Code of Conduct. Note that AT&T may take photographs at the workshop for promotional purposes. Please contact the event organizer through Eventbrite if you have any questions or concerns.

Have you heard about WebRTC? Do you want to try it out? Now’s your chance! Join the AT&T Developer Program for a free evening coding workshop on the AT&T Enhanced WebRTC API. 

This is not a marketing pitch, but rather a 3-hour, hands-on coding workshop taught by AT&T's lead architect for WebRTC. He will walk you through various coding examples then AT&T experts will provide help as you go through the lab exercises yourself. 

Analysts agree that WebRTC is one of the most disruptive telecommunications technologies to hit the street in years. The reason: WebRTC is not just about calling and conferencing apps, though it does those well. The real power is that it allows voice and video communications to easily be added to any web app. Just think of how that could increase the customer engagement of your applications.

An extra perk? Attendees will be entered in a drawing for an Acer Chromebook!

The workshop will focus on a carrier-agnostic version of the AT&T WebRTC API and will work with any web app running in Chrome. So come to the workshop to learn this exciting technology, network with AT&T experts and your fellow developers, and have some fun!

The event is free and we will be serving dinner.  Space is limited so register now.

results.description:
Our Happy Hours are targeted towards entrepreneurs, small business owners, investors, and people looking to network with Coalition members. We have all sorts of beers, chips, dip, and N64 games! We would love to meet you, have a conversation, play some Mario Kart, or just have a laugh! :]

Coalition: Boston is a flexible office and coworking hub for small businesses and startups. Located in the center of Downtown Boston, we are a strong, close-knit community of entrepreneurs, investors, and professionals who love to celebrate Hump Day on Wednesdays.

Thank you to our Sponsor, First Republic Bank!

Founded in 1985, First Republic and its subsidiaries offer private banking, private business banking and private wealth management, including investment, trust and brokerage services. First Republic specializes in delivering exceptional, relationship-based service, with a solid commitment to responsiveness and action. Services are offered through preferred banking or wealth management offices primarily in San Francisco, Palo Alto, Los Angeles, Santa Barbara, Newport Beach, San Diego, Portland, Palm Beach, Boston, Greenwich, and New York City. First Republic offers a complete line of banking products for individuals and businesses, including deposit services, as well as residential, commercial and personal loans.

Thank you to our Annual Sponsor, Botkeeper!

Botkeeper does everything a bookkeeper can do, only faster, 24/7, with more reporting, beautiful dashboards, and at a fraction of the cost. With the use of software and machine learning, botkeeper automates much of the day to day data entry, classification, and aggregation of information into reports and dashboards. Unlike a traditional bookkeeper, botkeeper is continuously improving and becoming more efficient over time, leading to amazing scalability and big savings for our clients. Knowing it is impossible to automate everything, all botkeeper clients are paired with a dedicated botkeeper CPA to provide a personal touch, advice, and quality assurance. 

FAQs

Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event?

You must present an ID to security to gain access to the building. 21+ event. 

What are my transport/parking options getting to the event?

We are located right above the Downtown Crossing T stop, part of the Red and Orange lines, and one stop away from the Green line at Park Street. Garage parking options can be found here: www.coalitionspace.com/parking 

Can I bring a friend?

We'd be dissapointed if you didn't. But if you don't have any friends, you can make some here! :)

What if I have a nut allergy?

We have Klondike bars!

What's the deal with airline food?

You'll have to ask Jerry Seinfeld.
results.name: HAPPY HOUR @ COALITION: BOSTON sponsored by First Republic Bank

results.description:
Please arrive 15-30 min before tee off time, pay greens fee, sign in and be prepared to tee off at 5:15.

Pine Oaks Golf Course in Easton, MA, has offered us 3 tee times at starting at 5:15pm on Wednesdays, through August 31.

I will post this weekly during the season and accept 12 players (ASGA members  are priority) plus a waitlist. The 9-hole fee is $18.  This is a very walkable course, but carts are available for $15.   If for any reason you need to cancel, please do so 24 hours ahead of time and change your RSVP.  This allows those on the waitlist time to fill your spot.

This event is open to official ASGA members initially, then to MeetUp members.   In fairness to our official ASGA members who have paid the $79 membership fee for the year, any meetup members or non-ASGA member will incur a $5 surcharge each week they play with us (except the first time).  To avoid the weekly surcharge, please go to www.singlesgolf.com and click 'join' to become a member.

Please review the Boston Chapter of ASGA Code of Conduct and Policy Statement located on this site under "Pages."

I will make plans at a local restaurant for the "19th hole” and post our dinner location a few days before each event.

If you have any questions, please email me by clicking on my profile and clicking on 'message.' This is a private email.

Looking forward to seeing everyone!  Let's play golf and have fun!
results.name: ASGA Nine & Dine at Pine Oaks

group.name: Boston Chapter -American Singles Golf Association®- ASGA

We will be playing outdoors at Bird Park in Walpole on Wednesday at 5:30 pm.

results.description:
Who should join: Beginners to Advanced speakers interested in learning how to improve their public speaking for fun or professionally.  Reduce your fear and increase your confidence.


Why  members should join: Learn the basics of public speaking, challenge your current skills to be a professional speaker or just to have fun & meet interesting people.  You will also be challenged to give more challenging types of speeches such as ice breakers, humorous and inspirational speeches.

What members can expect out of the group: We have a fast paced 1 hour meeting packed with 2 prepared speeches from members as well as Table Topics where anyone is invited to speak on a suggested topic for 1-2 minutes to hone their ability to speak off the cuff.


You can also join our mentorship program and be assigned an advanced speaker who will guide you to improving your skills.

Lead meetings and presentations at work, begin your path to being a better teacher or professional paid public speaker or simply be a better storyteller.

Tuesday 12pm meeting for members and guests. Please visit for free! 

All are welcome.
results.how_to_find_us: Clarendon street entrance. Ask the desk attendant for directions to room.
results.name: Attend a free meeting as a guest and consider joining!

results.description:
We're a bunch of folks with extremely varied levels of kickball skill - whether you're a star athlete or were picked last in gradeschool kickball, kickball's a great time! Just be a good sport and come wearing your drinking shoes for some post-game festivities. Charge is very nominal for kickball games - only a 1-time fee of $5 to help cover equipment costs (if you paid for any previous game, you're all set).

We'll be playing at Amory Park, accessible by bus or train. Its near the B (BU West) or C line (Hawes Street / Kent Street) in Brookline. This is a great location, and we'll likely hit up a local watering hole for post-game libations.

We'll set up camp wherever we can find space (if we can't nab an actual field), so call my cell to find us![masked]-7652. If you can't make it right at 5:45, no worries! We'll play til it's dark, so just join in when you can.
results.how_to_find_us: Green Line C train to "Hawes St" stop, turn right off Beacon St onto Amory St and the playground is just a few steps in. If driving, parking is free/easy, there is a lot.
results.name: Game 5 - Amory Park, Brookline!

results.description:
Wanna try us out? Come join us at our water training sessions! No prior experience necessary. 

• First two practices are $10 (The $10 can go towards the full membership of $110 for the rest of the season). Pay via Paypal ("Boston 1 - Join us") or venmo (@boston1dboat).</a>

• Also you will not be allowed on the boats if you do not sign the waiver: <a href="https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1Ll2NR3MZbV3O7ZrmPdZsCbKRaC_G8KKa7lwBUlC59Pk/viewform?c=0&w=1">"Boston 1 e-waiver" 

• Make sure to check our Facebook,</a><a href="http://bit.ly/Boston1facebook">http://bit.ly/Boston1facebook for practice announcements and cancellations -- especially in the early and later parts of season with potentially colder night practices. 

Weekly practices are every Monday, Wednesday and Saturday unless a race is scheduled or practice is cancelled.

Mon & Wed: 5:45pm - 8pm, meet 5.45pm on the grassy patch near the Barking Crab. 
Sat: 10:45am - 1pm, meet 10.45am on the grassy patch near the Barking Crab.

Optional dinner/lunch or social activity afterwards!

Outdoor paddling means exposure to the weather and water! Be prepared to get wet!

• Clothing: Wear workout clothes, synthetic fibers that dry quickly are highly recommended. Bring dry clothes to change into afterwards. 

• Footwear: Sandals or flip flops recommended. Some people go barefoot. Shoes and socks are not recommended. 

• Other: Bring plenty of water and sunscreen. Expensive glasses or sunglasses are not recommended. 

All paddling equipment is provided (paddles, pfds). Locked locker provided on-site. Please bring as little as possible to practice as space is limited.

In the event of inclement weather, announcements will be made through the comments area of each meetup event, also in Twitter, Facebook and email alerts.

Sign up for our weekly emails and email alerts

Twitter: @Boston1Dboat

Facebook: http://bit.ly/Boston1facebook

Parking: Channelside Parking at 284 A Street. Enter at 29-41 Necco Street, off Melcher Street. Weekend $5 flat rate. Weekdays $8 flat rate (in after 3pm). More details can be found here: http://bit.ly/1Nxv1lw.

Restroom: Do not use the restrooms in the Barking Crab, use the public restrooms near the Daily Catch

Public Transport: Closest T stop is South Station on the red line.

Hope to see you there!
results.name: Wednesday Water training

results.description:
REGISTRATION IS NOW OPEN for the spring season of the Jack’s Abby Social Tennis League! This year we’re pleased to announce an expanded offering of locations. 

Site Locations, Match Times and Starting Dates:

South Boston, MA @Joe Moakley Park: Wednesdays from 6-9 pm (Begins May 11th) 

South Boston, MA @ Joe Moakley Park: Thursdays from 6-9 pm (Begins May 12th) 

Medford, MA @Tufts University: Wednesdays from 6-9 pm (Begins May 11th)

Medford, MA @Tufts University: Thursdays from 6-9 pm (Begins May 12th)

Brookline, MA @ Waldstein Park: Tuesdays from 6-9 pm (Begins May 10th) 

Brookline, MA @ Waldstein Park: Thursdays from 6-9 pm (Begins May 12th) 

League Format:

The format for the Jack’s Abby Social Tennis League will be the same as last year – 7 weeks, 6 teams, 1-hour long matches, and restaurant specials after on-court play. Our first week will be a tennis jamboree open to everyone, weeks 2-6 will be round-robin team competition, week 7 will be an individual tournament unless utilized for rained-out match makeups.

Registration Details:

Registration for the league is through the Teamsnap mobile app or Teamsnap.com. Teamsnap is an easy-to-use social sports league application that:

1. Helps you save time communicating with your team on your phone 2. Provides you auto-notifications on schedule updates, changes and cancellations.  3. Allows you to send messages, send updates, track matches, share photos and more. Jack’s Abby Social Tennis League smartphone users are encouraged to download the Teamsnap application on their mobile devices.

USE THE LINK BELOW TO SIGN UP FOR TEAMSNAP AND REGISTER FOR THIS SPRING SEASON OF THE JACK’S ABBY SOCIAL TENNIS LEAGUE: https://go.teamsnap.com/divisions/72836/registration/24517/register/new

Don’t forget our referral program – We discount your registration fee $10.00 for every player who joins the league off your recommendation! 

Site Coordinator Search:

Interested in joining the Jack’s Abby Social Tennis League team?  Become a site coordinator, or team captain! Being a site coordinator is fairly simple, and often fun! If interested, please email [masked] to discuss the location you’re interested in coordinating!

Thanks everyone – I look forward to seeing you on court this spring!

Christo
results.name: Spring Season of Jack's Abby Social Tennis League

The Great American Tavern is a casual, fun, dining and entertainment establishment conveniently located at 303 Main Street (Route 28) in North Reading, Massachusetts. The open-concept floor plan, complete with 19-foot ceilings, modern lighting, and comfortable seating, helps set the tone for a casual, fun evening out – whether you choose to post up on a seat in the bar area, or relax in one of our oversized booths in the dining area. Our modestly priced menu offers large portions with options to satisfy even the pickiest of eaters, and the extensive drink menu features a list of specialty martinis, as well as 14 draft beer selections. Sports fan? Can’t decide which game to watch? Don’t sweat it! With 13 50-inch TVs in the dining and bar area alone, you’re guaranteed to spot your favorite game!

The Revolve Nation's Boston Entrepreneurs Network is the largest community of entrepreneurs and business owners in the city of Boston, offering networking, discussion groups, seminars, business plan hot-seats, and more!

Join us here, where professionals and entrepreneurs meet in mutual support of business to network, socialize, learn, and promote a thriving community of entrepreneurs. Wine and snacks provided!

Schedule:

6pm-6:30pm  -- Open Networking over wine and snacks

6:30-6:45pm  -- Meeting Called to Order and Introductions

6:45--7:45pm -- Open discussions on topics of interest to our members (examples; Getting funded, building a team, using mailing lists and their effectiveness, firing a difficult employee) Suggest your own topics as comments on the event, or simply bring them with you!

7:45-8:00pm  -- More Networking! (and wine!)

Like anything in life, what you put into a networking group is what you get out of it. The Boston Entrepreneurs Group is designed for entrepreneurs and professionals who are serious about building their business, investing in relationships, and helping each other to succeed.

The way the group seeks to achieve these outcomes:

1) Regular attendance

2) Dedication to coming prepared to contribute value to the community with expertise, experience, and networks.

3) Create a fun and supportive environment!

Price: FREE

SPONSORS: Revolve, Inc.: www.revolvethis.com

Exemplar Law: www.exemplarcompanies.com

See you soon!

Our speaker is Ivan Jusdon Ph. D. who is a Computer Scientist at Microsoft. This event is an opportunity for Boston AllJoyn members to discuss initiatives in the Internet of things from a Microsoft perspective.

An attendee commented that this group had "wonderful discussions on Smart Homes and IoT with technical people who have thought deeply about the issues".  (Thank you!)

We're back at the NERD center in Cambridge and limited to 20 people. So make sure to keep your RSVP up to date and meet Business Leaders, Product Managers and Developers in the Boston AllSeen / AllJoyn community.

results.description:
Come join us for drinks, appetizers and networking. This is an informal gathering for local Boston Real Estate Investors and a great opportunity to meet potential partners and mentors. The best way to push forward with your investing career is to surround yourself with people who want the same. Here's your chance! Look forward to seeing you there!

http://www.ester-dot.com/

Unlike most events we host, there is a $40 charge to attend this evening. All proceeds collected will be donated to the Boy's and Girls club of Boston to help support it's summer program and keep local children in a safe environment. Come support a great cause while making new connections!


About the Boy's & Girls Club
What We Do
Our mission is to help young people, especially those who need us most, build strong character and realize their full potential as responsible citizens and leaders. We do this by providing:
• a safe haven filled with hope and opportunity
• ongoing relationships with caring adults
• life-enhancing programs

Where We Work
BGCB currently operates five free-standing Clubs and six shared-space Clubs in Boston and Chelsea. We serve communities where the need for safe after-school, weekend and summer programming is greatest. BGCB also operates the YouthConnect program, in partnership with the Boston Police Department, and Camp Harbor View.

results.description:
Free. Fun. Starts here!

Welcome to the Marlborough Couch to 5K sponsored by ConnectingPoint Church. We love people in our community. We've helped over 400 people get off the couch and start jogging!


We have 2 groups: 

 1. Our Jogging Group has a goal of jogging a 5K. 

 2. Our Alumni Jogging Group has a goal of keep jogging for those who have jogged at least once season with us. 

We introduce people to jogging and getting fit. The program gradually moves you from walking at your own pace to jogging at your own pace. 

• FREE 10-week program to get you from the couch to running a 5K (3.1 miles) 

• Anyone from the community can participate

• Led by experienced runners 

• Monday through Thursdays 6pm-6:45pm; Sundays 8am-8:45am, with a goal of joining us 3 of these sessions per week 

• 45 minute time commitment

• Goal of jogging and finishing the Sprit of Hudson 5K in June 

Encourage those you love to get “off the couch” and join you in the great sport of running. Come have some fun! Bring a water bottle and join the group. 

Please arrive 15 minutes early the first night, so we can explain what you'll be doing on the Rail Trail, stretching out, etc.


 Please consult your doctor if you have a health or medical condition that prevents you from exercising. 

For more information please visit http://www.connectingpointchurch.org/couchto5k/

https://youtu.be/OndSmceU9R4
results.how_to_find_us: Park in the unpaved municipal parking lot to the left of 72 Jefferson Street
results.name: Marlborough Couch to 5K - Spring 2016

results.description:
THIS IS A PAID EVENT PURCHASE YOUR TICKET HERE

Melissa Withers (RevUp by Betaspring)

Melissa Withers is Managing Director of Betaspring. Betaspring has accelerated 92 companies and the portfolio has raised $65MM in follow-on funding and produced four exits. In 2015, Betaspring launched RevUp--the first accelerator for revenue-driven companies. She is also co-founder and director of Founders League, a co-working community in Providence, as well as a MassChallenge mentor and judge.

• Managing Director at RevUp, the first accelerator for revenue-first startups, pioneering a novel non-equity approach for building better companies.

• Experienced startup mentor advising ventures on PR, communications, customer discovery/engagement, marketing, team building, and management.

• Unique role developing communications for the Human Genome Project, one of the largest publicly funded science ventures in U.S. history, part of 6+ years service at Whitehead Institute for Biomedical Research at MIT

• Co-founder of the Business Innovation Factory, a leader in the design and testing of new and disruptive business models.

• 15+ years experience in strategic communications and public relations.

• Masters Degree in technical communications, special focus on emerging technologies.

Agenda

6:00 pm Food & Networking

7:00 pm Fireside Chat

8:00 pm Networking

Hosted By Carlos Cardenas, Boston Director

None


Global Partner

Google is committed to empowering entrepreneurs around the world through programs, partnerships, and our products.

AC Hotels is a stylish oasis with Spanish roots and European design. Our hotels are spaces made for creativity by day and social buzz by night

Local Sponsors

Pivotal Labs consists of fellow practitioners and startup veterans who have a history of solving problems with early stage companies.

THE MEME is a strategic design and innovation consultancy that provides engaging consumer experiences across diverse product and service platforms.

What is Startup Grind?

Startup Grind is a global startup community designed to educate, inspire, and connect entrepreneurs. We host monthly events in more than 170 cities and 65 countries featuring successful local founders, innovators, educators and investors who share personal stories and lessons learned on the road to building great companies. Our monthly fireside chat interviews, startup mixers and annual conferences provide ample opportunities to connect with amazing startups and the people behind them, tap into a strong support network, form meaningful connections and gain inspiration for the startup journey ahead. For more information visit StartupGrind.com or follow us on twitter @StartupGrind.
results.name: Melissa Withers (RevUp by Betaspring)

results.description:
Cannabis Society has been cordially invited to connect with fellow cannabioid lovers in the Boston area. Both Martin Lee (Project CBD's co-founder) and Sarah Russo (Creative Director) will be in town and would like to cross pollenate with those involved with CBD efforts in the area. This is the first Project CBD meet-up in on the east coast!

This will be an informal, getting-to-know-you style event. Let's discuss more about the CBD community in Massachusetts, connect, and find ways to collaberate. Patients, product makers, dispensary workers, scientists, activists, health professionals... all are welcome.

Project CBD (www.projectcbd.org) is a California based non-profit that provides educational news reporting on CBD, other components of the cannabis plant & herbal medicine synergies. The organization provides educational services for physicians, patients, industry professionals, and the general public. 

$10 suggested donation at the door. No one will be turned away for lack of funds.

A special thanks to 4Front Ventures for sponsoring the event. If you are interested in sponsorship options for this meet & greet please contact: [masked].

Legal Disclaimer  

Views or opinions expressed by speakers or sponsors at our local Cannabis Society community events do not necessarily express the opinion or views of the Cannabis Society organization and we do not take responsibility for the views expressed or the actions of speakers or sponsors at our local events. The Cannabis Society does not distribute cannabis.

The Cannabis Society is Growing  

Our group has grown by leaps and bounds these past few years and we are proud to announce that the Cannabis Society is going to continue to grow and develop our ecosystem with groundbreaking events centering around medical cannabis, technology, art, and science. We couldn’t do it without our members and we want to thank you for being apart of this growing organization.

Charleene's Country Line Dance Lessons take place Wednesdays in Weymouth (OR Angela hosts the Tuesdays in Braintree) and she has a great team helping her teach the classes. Beginner lessons @ 6-7pm and Advanced lessons @ 7-8pm. This is a fun way to learn several country line dances with others and get in a nice workout. You'll then be able to join in the fun when you are out and see other people line dancing. 

What to Bring/Wear:

~Water (they do not provide drinks and you will get thirsty)

~Cowboy Boots (if you have them), boots or shoes w/ heels; no sneakers!

~Comfy Clothes (remember, you're dancing!)

Cost is $10 cash ONLY.

Please plan to arrive a few minutes early if this is your first time attending. This way you can pay at the register and we can get introduced before the fun starts.

Inclement Weather Reschedule Date: TBD; FYI - This happens weekly and they don't dance if the governor says to stay off the road.


Parking: Free and ample parking on-site.

results.description:
This month we will have Faré Rideau speaking about First-class Implementations.

Abstract:

We formalize a general notion of implementing an operational semantics with another, representing such operational semantics as arbitrary categories. We then propose a runtime protocol using first-class implementations to asynchronously control an efficiently implemented computing system from another, "meta" system.

The key of the protocol is then a generalized notion of PCLSRing, that allows to "decompile" a concrete program's running state. Many "advanced" techniques can then be seen as instances of decompiling and recompiling such running state: garbage collection, process migration, configuration change, process virtualization, etc.

In particular, virtualization becomes a general purpose user-level primitive in the programming language applicable to arbitrary computing systems, rather than a special purpose system-level primitive in the operating system or runtime platform just for one low-level virtual machine. Various transformations can then be expressed in their natural simplest context while efficiently applied to other programs in a larger context.


Bio:

Faré is a cybernetician specialized in software growth
infrastructure and currently living in NYC. He is known as a Common Lisper for promoting Lisp as a scripting language, and having developed the build system ASDF 3 and the Lisp Interface Library combining ad hoc and parametric polymorphism. He recently left Google where he was working on the extension language of the build system Bazel.

He likes to think in terms of computing interactions and programming processes rather than computer devices and software artifacts; he once led the TUNES Project to reinvent computing and recently started a new blog on this topic, Houyhnhnm Computing. He relatedly believes in the power of storytelling and of evolutionism.

His other interests span music, fine arts, psycho-history,
epistemology, and more. He also spoke or was published at several libertarian venues. He tweets about computing as @ngnghm and on other topics as @fare. You also find him on LiveJournal or Facebook. Finally he maintains
a collection of quips.


Logistics:

If you can, please plan on arriving between 6:45pm and 7pm, but there will be someone in the lobby to greet stragglers.

Food:

Pizzas, salad and soda.

Afterwards:

If you'd like to stick around, a number of us tend to head down to the CBC or another pub afterwards to socialize. If you would like to give a talk or if you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to follow up here or email one of the organizers.
results.how_to_find_us: Simply come to the front door of Akamai. If you can, please plan on arriving between 6:15pm and 6:30pm, but there will be someone in the lobby to greet stragglers.
results.name: First-class implementations, a simple protocol for runtime metalevel programming

Come join us for a midweek climb!


To the left there is a chip-in feature. Your donations will go directly to the monthly dues and will allow MAC meetup group to keep going. Any amount would be greatly appreciated. Thank you.

All levels are welcome! If you are new to climbing, there is a belay class at 7 PM. Here is the link to sign up: www.centralrockgym.com/bookeo.php?s=watertown 

I will happily belay those who have not climbed before up until 7 PM, but then it's really important to know how to belay and to take the belay test that starts at 7 PM. You can rejoin the group after taking the belay test.

For those of you who already know how to belay, no need to take the class, you just need to pass this gym's belay test when you arrive.

The price is as follows:

Membership: $89/month

Adult Day Pass: $22 

Gear (shoes, harness, belay device): $8 ($5 for members)

Belay class: $15 (free for members)

Belay test: Free

We will meet at the cluster of cubbies on the first floor at 6:30 PM, greet each other, make sure everyone has a group or person to climb with then head off to climb. I'm looking into whether there is a place nearby to grab a bite or drink at the end of the night. If you have a place in mind, please let me know.

I'll send a message letting you know what color shirt and pants I am wearing incase you arrive late and want to search for us. I will also swing by the cubbies every 15 minutes until everyone who signed up has arrived. So, if you are not able to make it or are running late, PLEASE COMMUNICATE on this event's chat or by contacting my cell-phone, which I will send out once you are confirmed for the event.

Hope you can make it! I'm looking forward to meeting more climbers in the area.

~Avery~

results.description:
Highlighting the tooling  and workflows used to deploy multiple times a day. 

This month our members are sharing continuous integration and delivery workflows from their organizations. What tools are used, how does collaboration happen? 

Perfect is the enemy of good; come join us for discussion on CI/CD best practices and case studies.

Presentations:

• Richard Li (Datawire.io) - Continuous Delivery with Microservices: This talk is about microservices, what they are, why you need CD, and the CD ecosystem. 


• Dan Rowe (Wayfair) - Wayfair's Evolution: This presentation will highlight the tooling  and workflows used to deploy multiple times a day at Wayfair. 

• Barton Nicholls/Ed Rousseau (SimpliSafe) -Bootstrapping the Continuous Pipeline:  Spinnaker and how we have come to implement it as an essential component in our CD pipeline. Ed Rousseau will join the talk speaking from a QA perspective on the value it has brought to his team.


• Anthony Spring (Yieldbot) - At Yieldbot we have a single methodology for building an application and two methods for deployment.  This talk will discuss the unified building of artifacts, the process for deploying more traditional services, and the tools and processes used to deploy our containerized microservices running in Mesos.
results.name: Continuous Integration and Delivery

results.description:
Want to learn Public Speaking but not sure where to start?

Are you afraid of speaking in front of groups?

Use filler words like 'um', 'and', 'like', 'you know'?

Have no idea how to structure an interesting speech?

Then this is the place for you.

EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING

Our hands on class will give you a safe, supportive and fun atmosphere to practice public speaking with other beginners  who are also your supportive audience.

PERSONALIZED COACHING

When you sign up I'll ask you 1-2 specific goals you want to learn in class and I'll teach it to you!

It's a customized syllabus designed by you.

Not sure where to start? No worries, I'll teach you the beginning steps.

CREATE CONFIDENCE

Fear of speaking in front of a group?

Not to worry...you'll learn the coping mechanisms the professionals use and the fear will turn to excitement!


VIDEO FEEDBACK

Optional video taping of your speech is available so you can see yourself and make your own evaluation.

We upload your practice speeches to Dropbox and only the class students can see it later.

We can also video tape with just your smartphone for super privacy.

It's a powerful tool to evaluate yourself.


OTHER BENEFITS

Learn how to give a speech without notes and never forget what to say!

How about getting rid of those pesky 'ums', 'likes', 'you knows' and other filler words?  That's part of the class.

Have a specific project or presentation? Practice it in this class.

Let the President of Toastmasters Boston Copley share with you the basics of solid speech making.

Our small classes are designed to give you the individual attention, feedback and suggestions to help you thrive!

MONEY BACK GUARANTEE

If you feel it's not worth your money you get a 100% refund.  No questions asked.

See you there!

results.description:
Let's go hear a talk by the man who made headlines and ruffled HubSpot feathers with his tell-all book. He'll be speaking as part of Arlington's Community Education program.  $10 at the door.

Arlington H.S. has limited parking in the front of the school.  I think there may be additional parking in the back.  There is also street parking on Mass. Ave.

Let's meet in the lobby by 6:45pm.  We'll find seats together then.  I'll send my cell # to people who RSVP in case you're late and want to find us in the auditorium.


Event Description:

"For 25 years Dan Lyons was a leading tech journalist—until his job with Newsweek went away. Fifty years old with two young kids, Lyons accepted a job and a pile of stock options from Hubspot. His new employer made the world a better place...by selling email spam. Lyons describes the office vibe as frat house meets cult compound, where Nerf gun fights broke out at lunch and he was old enough to be his coworkers’ father. Disrupted is a hilarious story of self-reinvention and a definitive account of life in the tech bubble. Dan Lyons lives in Winchester with his wife and two daughters. In addition to his stint with Hubspot, he is a novelist, journalist, and screenwriter, most recently for the hit HBO comedy series Silicon Valley."

https://register.asapconnected.com/CourseDetail.aspx?CourseId=98717
results.name: "Disrupted: Dan Lyons' Misadventures in the Start-up Bubble"

Warning: Excessive fun & comradery developed from playing Ultimate may become addicting.
