results.description:
ABOUT THE EVENT:

How do you figure out the next step on your career path?  What do you do when you're the only woman in the room evangelizing your product?  How do you overcome implicit bias in technology?

These are just some of the questions professional women ask themselves as they try to navigate the world of product management, marketing and user experience in the technology industry.  Our panel of professionals will discuss their experiences as they faced a variety of these challenging situations.

This will be our second of a three-part storytelling series where seasoned professionals discuss topics focused on their experiences towards career success in the product field.  The topic discussion will be followed by a Q&A session and casual networking.  Light food and refreshments will be served.

Purchase your $10 tickets for the event on EventBrite


*BPMA Premium Members can attend for Free  Not a member?  Sign-up for before the event.

Tickets are $10

ABOUT THE PANEL:

Amisha Thakkar, Product Manager - Wolters Kluwer

</a>

Amisha Thakkar is passionate about building intuitive products and strongly believes that users should not have to read a manual to use most products.  She is a Product Manager at UpToDate and has led cross functional teams that were on different continents.  Amisha has done pretty much everything in the software business - written code, been a scrum master, brought back “down” systems to life, talked to customers.  She was an organizer on the BPMA’s PRODiE committee and presented at Product Camp 2016.

<a href="https://www.linkedin.com/in/ellenchisa">Ellen Chisa, VP of Product - Lola Travel

Ellen Chisa is the VP of Product at Lola Travel. Previously, she she was a Product Manager at Kickstarter, and a Program Manager for Office Mobile at Microsoft. She's on leave from the MBA Program at Harvard Business School and has a B.S. in Electrical & Computer Engineering from the Franklin W. Olin College of Engineering. She speaks, teaches, and writes about Product Management on a regular basis. In her free time she likes to play pinball and scuba dive.


Nichole Mace, VP of Product and Member Experience - Zipcar

With nearly 20 years of product strategy and market research under her (seat)belt, Nichole has a knack for creating the ultimate customer experience. She's held leadership roles at a number of companies, including Showable Media, High Start Group, ProspectPark Consulting, Constant Contact and Intuit.  When she isn't thinking about products, you can catch her at the yoga studio, on a hiking trip, or skiing at a nearby mountain. Nichole holds a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration from the University of Delaware and a Master of Business Administration from Babson College.


EVENT SPONSOR:
results.name: Storytelling: Managing Challenges in Your Product Career

Author's Night. The New Cosmos: Answering Astronomy's Big Questions David Eicher, Astronomy magazine

Over the past decade, astronomers have answered - or are closing in on the answers to - some of the biggest questions about the universe. David Eicher presents a spectacular exploration of the cosmos that provides you with a balanced and precise view of the latest discoveries. Among the "big science" topics covered will be dark energy, dark matter, water on Mars, the planethood of Pluto, the barred-spiral structure of the Milky Way, and the ubiquitous nature of black holes. results.description:
Greetings everyone! Mark your calendars now for our May OpenStack Meetup

Come on out and meetup as we get after the intersection of OpenStack and Platform as a Service (PaaS). We will review how you can combine OpenStack IaaS (such at Cisco Metapod) and PaaS (such as Apprenda) to create immense power and hit the following use cases:

• Layering a PaaS on top of OpenStack so the PaaS can autoscale

• Using Heat templates so DevOps can offer up third-party technologies to developers "as a service"

• Deploying apps in a containerized fashion using the PaaS

Our May session is being co-sponsored by Apprenda.

PRESENTER:

Boston-based engineer John “gif" Giffin will lead our session. Gif is a Senior Solutions Architect with Apprenda, where he helps people configure solutions around PaaS and Kubernetes. After a career deploying apps in the enterprise, he thinks we can do this a better way. Gif comes out of MIT with a degree in computer science and a minor in theater arts to keep him sane. Outside of the software arena, he's a martial artist and a foodie.


Reminders:

• A light dinner and soft drinks will be provided courtesy of Apprenda  ~ 6:15pm and we will kick off the sessions ~ 7:00pm.

• If you are interested in giving a Lightening Talk shoot us a note with a topic or just come to the session ready to speak!

• DON'T FORGET - for security reasons, the NERD center requires attendees to show a government issued photo ID in order to gain access into the building.

• Parking: Best option for parking is the NERD center parking garage which charges a flat rate after 4pm.
results.name: OpenStack IaaS and PaaS - match made in heaven or ...???

results.description:
Do you have a life dream? Does it feel unshakeable? Would you like to eliminate doubt and fear so you can move toward your dreams with confidence? Would you like experience the power of stepping into your future and seeing your dream alive?

Join us for this inspiring Heartbeat Salon workshop... where life coach, Susin James, will guide us to define, design, and experience the power of our life dream vision.


In 1853, Henry David Thoreau wrote a famous essay called “Walden”, in which he included a hidden code for prosperous living. During this dynamic workshop we will unlock this code so that you can tap into your dream, harness your life’s purpose and move toward the prosperous, fulfilled life you deserve!


To prepare for this evening, consider these questions:

• Have you ever had a life dream, but questioned at times if it was really right for you?

• What are some worries, doubts or fears you have about your dream?

Our leader this evening:


Susin James is a Certified DreamBuilder Coach and Life Mastery Consultant. She has worked with individuals and organizations, helping them build their dreams, accelerate their results, and create richer, more fulfilling lives. Susin has long supported personal growth and development both for herself and for others. She is an active member the Personal Growth Network, and our MetroCharles Heartbeat Salons. Before moving into heart-centered life and business coaching Susin worked for over 40 years as an Occupational Therapist and a Psychiatric Rehabilitation Counselor with people of all ages and wide range of special needs. 

Links

Most Important:   
  * Other, Upcoming Heartbeat Salons. 
  * Join our Heart Conversation on FaceBook

For Newbies:

Your Suggestions:

results.description:
This monthly Meetup is a place to learn tunes and to play them slowly with other musicians. The tunes we play can be found here (Sheet Music). Since the list is getting large we have started selecting a rotating list of about ten tunes a month that we will definitely play so that new members can have a chance to play along without learning every tune right away. I update this list and email it monthly.

This is still a new group, and how we go about learning and playing is still a work in progress. But the goal is to have fun, and to get together with others who enjoy playing Irish music. Musicians of all levels are welcome. Since the goal here is for everyone to play, new members are encouraged to suggest tunes from the list and to suggest tunes to add to it. If the group as a whole knows a tune well, we'll play it slowly a couple of times, and then pick the tempo up a bit. 

Note on tempo

If you have gone to a typical Irish Session, we play a little faster than half that speed. But we'll start tunes slowly enough that everyone should be able to play along and learn by ear. If you haven't been to a session it is best to just show up and see if the tempo suits you :)  If you like metronomes...  For Reels (4/4), Hornpipes (4/4) and Polkas (2/4) set the metronome from 100 to 140 BPM and play one quarter note per click. For Double Jigs (6/8), Slip Jigs (9/8), and Single Jigs (12/8) set the metronome from 65 to 95 BPM and play three eighth notes per click. 

Directions

By Subway

The closest Red Line stop is Davis Square. From Davis Square you can either walk Northwest on Holland Street or take the bus (the 87 or the 88) to Teele Square. It is about a 10 minute walk between Davis and Teele Square. You can recognize Teele Square as a 5-way intersection with a small triangular island having a sign that says Teele Square. From Teele Square walk North on Curtiss Street for 3 blocks to Powder House Boulevard. The church is on the NE corner of the intersection.

By Bus

The 87, 88, and 89 buses stop in Teele Square.  The 87 bus runs between Lechmere Station (Green Line) and Arlington Center. The 88 bus runs between Lechmere Station (Green Line) and the Clarendon Hill Busway. The 89 bus runs between Sullivan Square (Orange Line) and the Clarendon Hill Busway. You'll want to get off the bus in Teele Square. From Teele Square walk North on Curtiss Street for 3 blocks to Powder House Boulevard. The church is on the NE corner of the intersection. The 77 bus runs between Harvard and Arlington Heights. You can walk from Mass Ave to Teele Square.

By Car

There is parking behind the West Somerville School that is one block West of the church. Parking there is available after 5PM even though the signs are somewhat ambiguous. From Powderhouse, turn onto Curtis, heading up the hill toward Tufts. Take the first left turn from Curtis onto Raymond Street. Ignore the NO LEFT TURN sign, as it is only in effect during rush hours. Raymond runs behind the school. The lot is about half a block down Raymond on the left.

Street parking is also available one block away on Packard Avenue from Powderhouse Blvd on the hill to the Tufts University campus. Pay attention to street signs to avoid parking in a restricted area.

See the map at: http://clarendonhillchurch.org/...

Accessibility

The church has a lift that requires someone to move from a wheelchair to the chair on the lift. I haven't had time to look at this yet, but I will have someone show it to me over the holidays.

results.description:
"A universal theology is impossible, but a universal experience is not only possible but necessary. It is this experience toward which the course is directed." (ACIM Manual for Teachers)

Designed to correct perception and lead to a universal experience of knowledge, A Course In Miracles has been translated into 23 languages, is referenced and utilized by many of today's most reknowned spiritual teachers, and has inspired countless books and curriculums based on its teachings. But it can be a difficult book to grasp. It is lengthy, the writing is abstract, and its use of Christian terminology alienates many.

And yet it has become one of the most influential spiritual books of today. Join us as we dive into it, and are led to understand its principles against the backdrop of our own questions, personal experiences, and realizations. Beginner as well as advanced Course students are welcome. We'll start with a short meditation, and then use a reading from the Course as an entry point into our time together. Cost $5 per person.

Bringing a copy of the book is helpful, but not necessary. Recommended (but again not necessary) is the combined volume that includes the three supplements (Clarification of Terms; Psychotherapy: Purpose, Process, and Practice; The Song of Prayer), available online from The Foundation For Inner Peace at acim.org.
results.how_to_find_us: From Concord St.: we're 4/10th's of a mile down Russell St. on the right, the driveway after Fraser Farm.
results.name: Join us as we discuss A Course In Miracles and apply its principles to our lives

results.description:
Crossroads Irish Pub (Boston,  Beacon St and Mass Ave intersection) 7 pm to 10 pm

Due to requests and great turnout, Japanese Evening Table is going back to Crossroads! Grab a few drinks and some delicious cheap bar food. Whether you're learning Japanese or English, buy a drink, join the table, and practice your new language in a friendly and relaxed environment. If you're a beginner or just interested in culture, you'll fit in fine! Don't miss out on this opportunity to learn and practice over a few drinks. Can't make it on time? Need to leave early? Not a problem. Just stop by if you can!

If you are >21 and plan to drink, please bring a MA state issued ID or passport. Other state IDs may not be accepted. Please order at the bar and take care of your own tab.

Transportation: I highly recommend using public transportation. Not only is driving while intoxicated dangerous, but there may not be any parking available in the area. A lot of the parking in the area is Residential Only in the evenings, and many of the signs indicating this are very well hidden. Also, watch out for those hidden street cleaning signs! If you insist on parking in the area, be aware that meter maids love handing out parking tickets around here. Best methods for public transportation are the green line subway to Hynes or bus #1 to stop between Beacon and Marlborough.

Ordering at Crossroads: 

1) Order all your drinks and food at the bar. 

2) Start a tab (付け) or pay as you go. Don't forget to tip. 

See you there!
~Lindsay
results.how_to_find_us: Probably on the first floor, but look for the sign!
results.name: Backbay Japanese Evening Table

results.description:
[Here's a link to an excellent HuffPost interview with our guest author, Jennifer S. Brown: http://m.huffpost.com/us/entry/author-jennifer-brown-tal_b_9615890.html ]

I'm so pleased to announce that our May book club will be WITH THE AUTHOR of Modern Girls! Modern Girls is Jennifer S. Brown's debut novel and will be available in paperback on April 5. You can pre-order it now on Amazon: http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/045147712X?psc=1&redirect=true&ref_=oh_aui_detailpage_o00_s00 or purchase it at local bookstores: Porter Square Books, Brookline Booksmith, and Harvard Book Store. April 6, 7:00 p.m., is the book launch party at Porter Square Books (free and open to the public), at which Jennifer will be reading and signing books if you'd like to pick up a copy there.

Here is a little about the book:

A dazzling debut novel set in New York City’s Jewish immigrant community in 1935...

How was it that out of all the girls in the office, I was the one to find myself in this situation? This didn’t happen to nice Jewish girls.
In 1935, Dottie Krasinsky is the epitome of the modern girl. A bookkeeper in Midtown Manhattan, Dottie steals kisses from her steady beau, meets her girlfriends for drinks, and eyes the latest fashions. Yet at heart, she is a dutiful daughter, living with her Yiddish-speaking parents on the Lower East Side. So when, after a single careless night, she finds herself in a family way by a charismatic but unsuitable man, she is desperate: unwed, unsure, and running out of options.
After the birth of five children—and twenty years as a housewife—Dottie’s immigrant mother, Rose, is itching to return to the social activism she embraced as a young woman. With strikes and breadlines at home and National Socialism rising in Europe, there is much more important work to do than cooking and cleaning. So when she realizes that she, too, is pregnant, she struggles to reconcile her longings with her faith.
As mother and daughter wrestle with unthinkable choices, they are forced to confront their beliefs, the changing world, and the fact that their lives will never again be the same….


Looking forward to an incredible evening--hope you can make it!

Diane

results.description:
The Biomolecular Prototyping Unit (BPU) is a research pipeline to rapidly answer questions posed in the form of DNA. “What is the best drug to give an HIV-infected patient?” and “Can I design genetic circuits to diagnose any type of cancer?” are sample questions. A third question is “What genetic code can we engineer into a living creature to make it immune to all known viruses?” Our technical challenge is to integrate short DNA (oligonucleotide) synthesis, larger scale DNA assembly (to multiple kilobase pairs), on-chip expression (cellular and cell-free options), and diverse assays to quantify the encoded functions. Our approach to this integration is to miniaturize and connect these processes using microfluidics. I will present our current progress toward this vision of the BPU.

Dr. Peter A. Carr is Senior Staff at MIT Lincoln Laboratory, where he leads the Synthetic Biology research program. His research interests span genome engineering, rapid prototyping of both hardware and wetware, DNA synthesis and error correction, risk evaluation, and biodefense. Dr. Carr received his bachelor’s degree in Biochemistry from Harvard College, and his PhD in Biochemistry and Molecular Biophysics from Columbia University. Over the past decade he has become especially enamored with the synthetic biology approach – applying engineering principles to biological systems.

This presentation is a joint meeting of  the GBC/ACM and the Boston Chapter of the IEEE Computer Society.
results.how_to_find_us: We will be in the main auditorium on the 1st floor of the Broad Institute, corner of Main and Vassar Streets in Cambridge.
results.name: Biomolecular Prototyping Unit - Rapidly Asking Questions with DNA w Peter Carr

results.description:
Award-winning Fresh Seafood on Boston's North Shore

The Village Restaurant in Essex Thursday @ 8:15 pm

Come join North Shore Social for an amazing dinner and fantastic company. I found this gem of restaurants and can't wait to share it again with the group. 

"My favorite is Essex's Village Restaurant ... There is something special about the clams here," says acclaimed New York Times food writer, Mark Bittman. "No clam lover should pass through Cape Ann without sampling a plateful of the best soft-shells in the universe." (see more Village Restaurant reviews here.)

So, what's the secret? Quality & freshness. Our clams are dug right here—in Essex & Ipswich—by local clammers. We know every clammer personally and they know us. They know we only buy the sweetest, freshest, highest quality clams. It's that simple—and it's been that way since we opened in 1961.

The same goes for all of our fish and seafood. It's fresh. It's local. It's real.

The world's top food critics love The Village in Essex (see why). But don't take their word for it. Come, taste for yourself. Enjoy classic New England cuisine with a contemporary flair at affordable prices.

results.description:
Spring Clean Your Life 

Thursday, May 19|7:30 pm - 8:30 pm


It's spring! It's time to clean and dust off those cobwebs. Not just the ones in your home or workplace,But also the ones in your actual life.

Get rid of the past hurts, misunderstandings and grudges you've been hanging onto. Throw out the outdated perceptions, the negative attitudes and habits that no longer work for you.Air out, de-clutter and clear out your heart, mind and life. As the saying goes, "you have to get rid of the old to make way for the new." Not only will you free up space to bring new things into your life, but you'll also feel much lighter and more rejuvenated.


 So ready your feather duster and join us.
results.name: Spring Clean Your Life

venue.name: Phillips Auditorium, Harvard-Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics

results.description:
Events for the Public

The Harvard-Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics sponsors a variety of free programs for the public. Among these events are Observatory Nights held on the third Thursday of the month (excluding June, July and August). Observatory Nights feature a nontechnical lecture and telescopic observing from the observatory roof if weather permits. The lectures are intended for high-school age and older audiences but children are also welcome. We also sponsor a variety of other special astronomical events throughout the year. No reservations are necessary, but seating is limited to the auditorium's capacity. Admission is free.

These events--unless otherwise noted--are held in Phillips Auditorium (at the rear of the CfA complex near Madison Street and large parking lot), 60 Garden Street, Cambridge, about 1 mile west of Harvard Square. Parking lots marked for Observatory Staff are open to the public on event nights. Parking is free.

The Observatory does not host private events.

Monthly Observatory Night
Thursday, May 19, 2016
7:30 pm: Author's Night. The New Cosmos: Answering Astronomy's Big Questions


David Eicher, Astronomy magazine


Over the past decade, astronomers have answered - or are closing in on the answers to - some of the biggest questions about the universe. David Eicher presents a spectacular exploration of the cosmos that provides you with a balanced and precise view of the latest discoveries. Among the "big science" topics covered will be dark energy, dark matter, water on Mars, the planethood of Pluto, the barred-spiral structure of the Milky Way, and the ubiquitous nature of black holes. There will be a book sale and signing at this event.

For more information, including accessibility, or to sign up for the events mailing list, call the Public Affairs Office, (617)[masked] or email [masked]. Please request sign-language interpretation at least 2 weeks before the event. Current sky information is available.

Entrance is at the west of the CfA complex, near Madison Street and large parking lot. The CfA is easily reached by public transportation. From the Harvard MBTA Station (Red Line), take any bus or trackless trolley going west on Concord Avenue (Arlmont Village and Belmont Center buses, Huron Avenue trolleys) and get off at "Observatory Hill."

Source(s): http://www.cfa.harvard.edu/publicevents

Also available via their YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/user/ObsNights
results.name: Author's Night. The New Cosmos: Answering...  - Monthly Observatory Night

results.description:
Join us to eat, drink, write, share work, trade author/book recommendations, and more!

Thursday Format:
After a round of introductions, we start out with a general, unstructured freewrite to get everyone in the writing mindset. We continue writing to a series of three or so writing prompts that usually one of the organizers has prepared before hand. Members are encouraged to share their work, or what they wrote about, for each prompt. We spend the remainder of the group working on our own separate projects, continuing work from one of the prompts, freewriting, or just chatting with each other.

When we have a piece to workshop, we often will write to two or so prompts, and then will go into a discussion of that piece. The workshop may take up the rest of the group, or may conclude with time left at the end.


Read more about workshops here.

results.description:
Ongoing class in Medieval and Renaissance Longsword in the tradition of Johannes Lichtenauer.


The Longsword is the iconic fantasy Knight's sword - a two-handed, straight blade with a cross guard. The weapon may seem to be simple at first but is in reality a weapon of finesse and skill.


The class covers all the basics of footwork, attacks and defenses. Drills are developed from simple to complex; from rigidly choreographed to open-ended. Timing, distance and judgement are developed.


All classes begin with a Strength & Conditioning program designed to physically prepare one for fighting with the sword. Elements develop agility, core stability and power.

Attention Boston Fashion Meetup Members: Tomorrow night TRacy by Tracy Belben will show the new collection of dresses, ready to wear, and brand new designs at The Liberty Hotel. Stop by the Pop up shop to meet the designer and mingle with other fashion focused attendees. Complimentary admission - we simply can't wait to see you there!

About TRacy by Tracy Belben:

Tracy Belben was an unemployed architectural designer who needed a creative outlet between sifting through job listings. She began making experimental jewelry from random household items and over time, her handmade creations evolved into the luxurious collection known as TRacy (pronounced Tee-Racy).

Tracy’s work has been featured at the Institute of Contemporary Art (Boston) and Refinery29 + Simon Malls "The Shopping Block" Event, IHateBlonde (Blog), Vogue Italia, and Staples websites. Her work was sold in NYC at Patricia Field Boutique, owned by legendary “Sex and The City” & “Devil Wears Prada” stylist Patricia Field.

Each piece is meticulously handcrafted, by the artist herself, in her home studio in Massachusetts (USA).

http://t-racy.com

Instagram & Twitter: @T_Racy_Design

Facebook: http://facebook.com/t.racy.design.shop

results.description:
“The Kelly Way” — Brian Kelly’s Personal Success Story at the North Shore Business Forum’s Meeting on Friday, May 20, 2016

Brian Kelly, The Kelly Automotive Group

Brian Kelly, President of The Kelly Automotive Group, will share his personal success story, highlighting the major keys that make The Kelly Automotive Group profitable, reputable, and one of the top places to work year after year as recognized by The Boston Globe, The Automotive News, and Dealer Rater. Employee treatment, retention and benefits are just a few factors at work in Brian’s “Mirror Theory” — the idea that the way your employees treat your customers is a direct reflection of how your business treats its employees. 

About the Speaker: Brian Kelly, President of The Kelly Automotive Group, was born and raised on the North Shore. He began his business career at age eight with lemonade stands and paper routes, and then buying and refurbishing small boats and motors. At age 13, he was sweeping floors and changing light bulbs at his father’s used-car lot, and by age 16, he was taking customers for test drives. A 1970 graduate of Claude H. Patton Vocational School in Beverly, Brian went on to NADA Executive Training and purchased his father’s Datsun dealership in 1980. That was the start of The Kelly Automotive Group, which now boasts 12 brands at nine locations. This has been a family-owned and operated business through three generations over 50 years. Under Brian’s watch, the company has won excellence awards from Infiniti, Nissan, Honda, Volkswagen, and Jeep/Chrysler, is one of the top 100 dealers nationwide for volume sales and gross revenue, and has achieved some of the highest Customer Satisfaction scores in the US. Brian maintains a healthy lifestyle that he believes affords him the energy to run a company with 500+ employees. For more information, contact http://www.kellyauto.com/.

The North Shore Business Forum, Inc. (NSBF) is a group of small business owners from Boston’s North Shore who meet on the first and third Friday of each month for informal lectures given by business owners on a wide variety of topics. Members give a 30-second introduction of their business at each meeting. All business owners are welcome: future, past, profitable, experienced or beginning. Meetings are from 7:30 to 8:30 a.m. (registration starts at 7:15) at Acapulcos, 900 Cummings Center, Beverly, MA. The $10.00 admission fee includes a breakfast buffet. No pre-registration necessary.
results.name: Brian Kelly's Success Story

results.description:
In 2016, Bike to Work Week will be May 16-20, with Bike to Work Day on May 20.

**Sign up if you intend to take your bike to work that day *** 


40% of all trips in the U.S. are less than two miles, making bicycling a feasible and fun way to get to work. With increased interest in healthy, sustainable and economic transportation options, it’s not surprising that, from 2000 to 2013, the number of bicycle commuters in the U.S. grew by more than 62 percent.


Hundreds of American communities have been successful in increasing bicycle commuting by providing Bike to Work Week and Bike to Work Day events.


In fact, among the 51 largest U.S. cities, 43 hosted Bike to Work Day events in 2010. The City of Denver reported the highest rate of participation with one out of every 28 adults participating in its 2010 Bike to Work event. That effort makes a difference: Many people who participate in their Bike to Work Day promotion as first-time commuters become regular bike commuters.


But Bike Month is more than one day — or week! From fashion shows to group rides, local groups find unique ways to celebrate their diverse bike cultures and community pride.

On Bike to Work Day, you can join a bike commuter convoy from one of dozens of locations throughout the Boston metro area. Guided convoys with experienced ride leaders will follow a fixed schedule and route and finish together at City Hall Plaza in Boston. Because you rode your bike, you’ll get a free breakfast and coffee, set to music amid an expo at City Hall Plaza. Join a convoy, or just show up for the fun at City Hall Plaza. Going to work after the event is optional.


http://www.bostonbikes.org/events/bike-fridays/fridays


General Schedule:


6:45 AM Meet with convoy.
7:00 AM Convoys depart (except from Needham).
7:30 — 8:30 AM Convoys finish at City Hall Plaza.
7:00 — 9:00 AM Free breakfast and expo. 


*Exact times will vary by route. See detailed list of convoy stops and times for exact times*

See the route map  with schedule.
results.how_to_find_us: City Hall Plaza
results.name: National Bike to Work Day !!  + Festival + Free Breakfast

results.description:
RSVP Here:  http://odsc.com/boston/

Workshop Highlights


Every attendee will leave with a working Docker image running on their local laptop with a complete end-to-end machine learning data pipelinefor generating and serving recommendations using the PANCAKES Pipeline:

Presto,Akka,NiFi,Cassandra,AirFlow,Kafka,ElasticSearch,Spark

In addition to PANCAKES, we will also explore Docker, Zeppelin, iPython/Jupyter, Redis, Logstash, Kibana, TitanDB, Twitter Algebird, SparkR, and Stanford CoreNLP.


Pre-requisites For Attendees

• Laptop with at least 8 GB RAM

• Curiosity for Machine Learning and Graph Algorithms 

• Appreciation for Streaming vs. Batch Data Processing

• Basic Linear Algebra, Dot Product, Matrix Multiplication, etc

• Interest in Exploring Visualizations Beyond Basic Plots

Agenda 

Part 1 (Morning)

• Introductions

• Setup Environment (Docker)

• Demos!! (Zeppelin, Jupyter/iPython)

• SQL, Streaming, ML, Graph Components (Spark)

• Actors, Reactive, Streams (Akka)

• Data Modeling, CAP, Quorum (Cassandra)

• Logs, Topics, Partitions (Kafka)

• Cluster-based Item-Item and User-User Recommendations (Spark ML)

• Graph-based Similarity Pathway Recommendations (GraphX, TitanDB)

Part 2 (Afternoon) 

• Collaborative Filtering User-Item Recs (Spark ML)

• Streaming and  Approximations (Twitter Algebird, Redis)

• Dynamic Streaming Workflows, Data Provenance (NiFi)

• Search, Geo, and Graph Analytics (ElasticSearch)


• Interactive Data Exploration (Presto)

• Workflow Management (Airflow)

• Hybrid On-Premise, Cloud-based Deployments (Docker)

• Save Your Environment to Take Home (Docker)

• Wrap Up

About the Speaker

Chris Fregly is a Principal Data Solutions Engineer for the newly-formed IBM Spark Technology Center, an Apache Spark Contributor, and a Netflix Open Source Committer. 

Chris is also the founder of the global Advanced Apache Spark Meetup and author of the upcoming book, Advanced Spark @ advancedspark.com. 

Previously, Chris was a Data Solutions Engineer at Databricks and a Streaming Data Engineer at Netflix.
results.name: [Boston][RSVP] Open Data Science Conference Spark Workshop

results.description:
Step into history with a Ranger led tour on Friday, May 20 to follow the steps of the British Marines and soldiers who fought at Bunker Hill.   We will meet at the visitor center beside the Constitution ship in the Navy Yard at 10:45 and at 11:00 start our tour, typically along the Freedom trail and then up to Bunker Hill.  At the completion of the tour, you can then choose to climb the monument while non-climbers can sit and enjoy a view of the city or visit the museum at foot of monument.   The tour is approx. 45-55 minutes after which we will walk back down to the Navy Yard to enjoy lunch and the view of Boston at Pier 6 restaurant.

This is not a pre-paid event.  Thus, we will pass an envelope around at lunch to collect the price of your order plus 25% for tax and tip.  See menu link below to help plan the cost.  Cash only, no credit cards.  Please bring small bills to pay exact as much as possible.  Very hard to make change.

 After lunch, while the Meetup schedule ends, there are other activities of interest that you can choose if you wish – board the Constitution ship, museum, visitor center or even head to the Warren Tavern, oldest pub in Boston, to enjoy a Friday afternoon refreshment. 

Options to get to Navy Yard:   Boat from long Warf; MBTA to North Station and walk 10-15 minutes across bridge into Navy Yard, car.

view menu here: http://pier6boston.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/09/4_5_16_P6_LUNCH_MENU_8_5x11.pdf

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball.

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.

results.description:
Come to the Pivotal-EMC Dojo to see a live demo of project UniK! Even see UniK make toast with Raspberry Pi & Cloud Foundry!

UniK (pronounced you-neek) is a tool for compiling application sources into unikernels (lightweight bootable disk images) rather than binaries. UniK runs and manages instances of compiled images across a variety of cloud providers as well as locally on Virtualbox. UniK utilizes a simple docker-like command line interface, making building unikernels as easy as building containers. & UniK is built to be easily extensible, allowing (and encouraging) adding support for unikernel compilers and cloud providers. See architecture for a better understanding of UniK's pluggable code design.

If you aren't in the area & can't make it to the Dojo watch it live here: Live Google Hangout


To learn more about the motivation behind project UniK, read our blog post: Unik: Build and Run Unikernels the Easy Way

To stay up-to-date on UniK, follow us @EMCDojo
results.how_to_find_us: Google 145 Broadway, we are on the 3rd floor
results.name: UniK LIVE Demo: Unikernel Orchestration Tool for Developers

results.description:
For the week of Together 2016 festival we invite you to visit the Mmmmaven Recharge Lounge. It will open Monday, May 16th through the 22nd as your place to meet festival-goers and the Together team, listen to local DJs, power up, relax, and hydrate before the evening's festivities. Don't miss hands-on interactive workshops with leading music technology brands, like Novation, Ableton, and Denon more. Check out full schedule here.

Whether you are making music with Ableton Live or any one of a host of IOS apps, Ableton Link enables you to play in time with other musicians over a network. In this session, Ableton’s Ben Casey gives you the lowdown and introduces some of his favorite Link compatible apps. We’ll conclude the session with a live jam featuring Ableton and Mmmmaven instructors.


Ben Casey is a Brooklyn-based electronic musician, Ableton Certified Trainer, and overall music tech nerd. When he’s not surrounded by wires and drum machines or tinkering with Max for Live, Ben teaches Ableton Live to musicians across all genres, from avant-garde to zydeco.

While living in London he earned an MMUS from Goldsmiths University, and released tracks on the inscrutable UK-based label Werk Discs. Upon returning to the US, he founded a boutique electronic instrument business.

A Live user since its very beginning, Ben is always happy to show off his boxed copy of Version 1. He works with Grammy-winning artists to integrate Live into their existing production and performance workflows, consulting on numerous live tours, theater productions, and art installations.

With a focus on teaching the tips and tricks that allow musicians at any skill level to harness the power of Live, Ben is available for one-on-one sessions and group lessons in person, or Skype lessons worldwide.

Follow Together on Twitter, Instagram, & Facebook!

results.description:
PowerShell wizards Matt Nelson and Will Schroeder are in town for Security BSides. They have offered to be the speakers for our Boston PowerShell User Group May KickOff meeting.

Sessions

• Offensive Active Directory With PowerShell

• Building an Empire With PowerShell

Logistics

We hope to have one or two presentations including demos and a Q&A. I am organizing a sponsor to provide us with food and drinks as well.

They are only in town for one night so hopefully as many people as possible can make it.

Note that Microsoft requires that attendees check in with a photo ID.

Abstracts

Offensive Active Directory With PowerShell

Active Directory has been covered from a system administration aspect for as long as it has existed. However, much less information exists on how adversaries abuse and backdoor AD, leaving many defenders blind to the attacks being executed in their own environment. We'll cover Active Directory from an offensive perspective, illustrating ways that attackers move through Windows networks with ease. PowerView (the PowerShell domain enumeration tool) will be highlighted, including how to use it for local administrator enumeration, domain trust hopping, user hunting, ACL auditing, and more.


Building an Empire With PowerShell


Over the past few years, attackers have started to realize that the same aspects of PowerShell that make it an excellent Windows automation solution also make it an ideal attack platform. The Empire project aims to bring together various offensive projects into a fully-functional malware agent (written purely in PowerShell) that can be used offensively by red teams and used to train blue teams to defend against these types of attacks.
results.name: PowerShell User Group Kick Off Meeting - PowerShell and Security

19 tickets left to event as of 5/11. Get them now before they are gone! Join FamilyAid Boston, Down the Road Brew Co. at Impact Hub Boston for a fun and delicious evening of craft beer and pizza to benefit homeless parents and children in Boston!                           


Enjoy and compare 3 full pours (12 oz) from Down the Road Beer Co. paired with artisanal pizza.

Sign up here: 


Featured Beers: 

Rasenmäher Kölsch: Crisp, true-to-style Kölsch is brewed using traditional German methods, German Pilsner malt and German noble hops. It’s as authentic as it is refreshing. ABV:4.5% IBU:23

New Release: Feyborn Berliner Weiss: A delicate swirl of juicy sweet and refreshing sour ale. This quenching brew is a staple of spring and summer in Germany. Popularly served “Mitt Schuss,” the beer is accompanied with a nip of sweetened syrup to add a spontaneous blast of berry or herbal flavor.  ABV: 4.5% IBU: 0

Seventh Star IPA: A ripe, fruity brew that features the elusive and experimental Idaho 7 hop. This new contender boasts bright notes of melon, grape and strawberry, which we offset against a light swirl of Azaca hops, allowing for just a splash of tropical fruit.  ABV: 7% IBU:70 

</a>

•We will meet for mass at 6:30 p.m. followed immediately for Libations and food at The Barbeque outside.

• The Sardines'  STORY

Early Thursday morning after midnigh the freshly caught "Sardinia"--caught in the Atlantic Waters off of the Azores towards the mainland Portugal--are then shipped in the wee hours of the morning to the carriers that are boarded on Aircraft at Lisbon International Airport. Subsequent delivery has already been made early this morning to Logan Airport. These are not the little type of sardines that you see in a can at all, rather they are big fish for their variety as depicted in the photograph at the top of the monastic cooking club main page.

There are all different types of foods during this three-day Festival including the state tip BBQ which we will cook as a group Sunday late afternoon / early evening.

Saturday evening includes a great dance and Sunday evening includes the Battle of the Bands with full orchestral bands playing back and forth from different communities.

We will attempt to announce separate Meetup times very briefly for some of these highlights.

We still need volunteers for the barbecue preparation. Please RSVP ASAP!

results.description:
[This is not a CAH event, it is a courtesy posting for our friends, the Greater Lowell Area Science-based Skeptics.
Please RSVP on their event page:
http://www.meetup.com/Greater-Lowell-Area-Science-based-Skeptics/events/230676045/ ]

Genetically modified organisms (GMOs), a subject of heated interest by many. What is it? What is it not? How can we know the difference?

Please join us Friday, May 20th for a special presentation with genetic scientist Dr. Larry Gilbertson, who leads Monsanto's biotechnology facility in Cambridge, MA.
Larry will be discussing the science of GMOs and the research being done at Monsanto. Joining Larry is Dr. Mary Mangan, a genome scientist, president of OpenHelix, LLC, and member of the Boston Skeptics. Mary will help facilitate the discussion with questions from social media and the audience.

This is your chance to bring whatever GMO questions that have been tickling your skeptic brain. Also, you are encouraged to bring family and friends that may also have questions or just want to know more about this topic and the research at Monsanto.

We are very happy to have Larry and Mary come visit our group. Lindsay and I have seen them give this talk previously and we both really enjoyed it. We think you'll enjoy it as well and find it very informative. Please don't miss this presentation!

6:30pm - order food and socialize
7:15pm - presentation begins

Remember, family and friends are welcome. If you think you know somebody who would appreciate this discussion, please bring/invite them.

~GLASS~
results.name: [Special Presentation] GMOs: Yes, No, and Know

results.description:
This event is hosted by The Greater Lowell Area Science-based Skeptics, via http://www.meetup.com/Greater-Lowell-Area-Science-based-Skeptics/events/230676045.

* * * * * 

Genetically modified organisms (GMOs), a subject of heated interest by many. 
What is it? What is it not? How can we know the difference?

Please join us Friday, May 20th for a special presentation with genetic scientist Dr. Larry Gilbertson, who leads Monsanto's biotechnology facility in Cambridge, MA.

Larry will be discussing the science of GMOs and the research being done at Monsanto. Joining Larry is Dr. Mary Mangan, a genome scientist, president of OpenHelix, LLC, and member of the Boston Skeptics. Mary will help facilitate the discussion with questions from social media and the audience.

This is your chance to bring whatever GMO questions that have been tickling your skeptic brain. Also, you are encouraged to bring family and friends that may also have questions or just want to know more about this topic and the research at Monsanto.

We are very happy to have Larry and Mary come visit our group. Lindsay and I have seen them give this talk previously and we both really enjoyed it. We think you'll enjoy it as well and find it very informative. 

Please don't miss this presentation!

6:30pm - order food and socialize

7:15pm - presentation begins

Remember, family and friends are welcome. If you think you know somebody who would appreciate this discussion, please bring/invite them.
results.how_to_find_us: The group will be in the Fireside Dining Room.

venue.name: The Vilna Shul, Boston's Center for Jewish Culture

results.description:
Join us for our monthly Kabbalat Shabbat celebration at the historic Vilna Shul. This May we welcome Galit Schwartz as our honored guest speaker. Galit is the founder and owner of Power Cafe in Watertown, a coffee shop run, operated, and decorated by people with physical or developmental disabilities. New faces are always welcome at Havurah on the Hill, so bring your friends.

Festivities begin with an informal pre-nosh with wine and veggies. We then move up to the sanctuary for an egalitarian Shabbat service led by members of our community, followed by a discussion with our guest speaker, before finally heading back downstairs for a relaxed, inviting kosher buffet dinner.

Schedule of Events:
6:30 PM Wine and Appetizers
7:00 PM Shabbat Services
8:15 PM Talk given by Galit Schwartz, followed by Q & A
8:45 PM Kosher Buffet Shabbat Dinner
(vegetarian and gluten free options available)

Suggested donation $10.00 per person.
Please register at http://www.vilnashul.org/events/event/havurah_on_the_hill_young_adult_kabbalat_shabbat. Free validated parking is always available for Havurah on the Hill's monthly Shabbat celebrations at the Charles River Garage (165 Cambridge Street, Boston). Please note that this is NOT the above-ground Whole Foods lot, but the parking garage bewteen the Whole Foods lot and the Au Bon Pain. Please bring your green ticket into the Vilna for a validation stamp. The Vilna Shul is also easily accessible by public transportation. Take the MBTA Red Line to Charles/MGH. For driving, walking and public transport directions, please visit http://www.vilnashul.org/about/location.

About Galit Schwartz:
Galit Schwartz has worn many hats: Software Engineer, Math Teacher, and Mommy, to name a few. In the last few years, she has been volunteering with children with Down syndrome through the Down Syndrome Learning Program, and discovered the world of special needs. Through personal contacts and social media, she learned that while many resources exist for children with disabilities, these largely disappear when the children grow up. For example, people with disabilities face an employment rate of less than 20%. Inspired by stories about establishments such as Tim’s Place in Albuquerque, NM, Galit started wishing that a similar venue would open in the Boston area. As luck would have it, she was invited to participate in a workshop through Landmark Education to “create a project in the community which makes a difference and empowers others.” Galit used this opportunity to turn the dream of the Power Cafe into reality. Power Cafe is committed to supporting those with disabilities as much as possible through partnerships with the café. The art on the walls of the cafe comes from Gateway Arts in Brookline, MA, an art studio and gallery for adults with disabilities. Coffee beans for the cafe are sourced from Furnace Hills Coffee in Maryland, a roaster with Down syndrome. Galit and the team at Power Cafe are excited to be a part of the Watertown community. Everyone at the Power Cafe is appreciative of the support of its customers and knows that together we can “empower people of all abilities, one cup of coffee at a time.” Havurah on the Hill is a non-denominational, egalitarian minyan for Jews in their 20s and 30s in the Boston area. HOH meets at the Vilna Shul in Beacon Hill, the last remaining immigrant-era synagogue building in downtown Boston and hosts monthly Kabbalat Shabbat services as well as other special holiday celebrations throughout the year.
results.name: Havurah on the Hill Young Adult Kabbalat Shabbat

results.description:
A new monastic, Venerable Jue Qian, the newly-installed Director of Fo Guang Buddhist Temple (FGBT) Boston, formerly the Greater Boston Buddhist Cultural Center) has arrived in Greater Boston. 

Some of you recall that some of the non-Taiwanese criticism of GBBCC was that it didn't easily 'universalize' the Buddhist teachings and it concerned itself more with 'ministering to' Taiwanese Buddhists of the Fo Guang Shan tradition (based in Taiwan, it's an extremely large Buddhist group with healthcare facilities, monasteries, universities, and social services - rivaled there only by Tzu Chi).

The Venerable Jue Qian is believed to have much relevant experience with the localization of Buddhism within a variety of English-speaking communities.

She has earned both an undergraduate degree in Chinese Buddhism and Masters Degrees in both Buddhist Studies and Business.  She has conducted English-language Buddhism classes and meditation workshops in temples, prisons, hospitals, high schools, colleges, and universities, and has participated in interfaith conferences on various topics related to service, principle, and perspective. 
Local FGSBT members welcome her to their temple and serious, earnest spiritual inquirers to their gathering sites.

Under Venerable Jue Qian’s leadership, FGSBT is beginning anew with "Dharma With Dinner" at their very own building at 711 Concord Avenue, Cambridge, MA.
(See the information below for directions.)   

They again invite serious, earnest inquirers after several years and together start the work of "rebuilding their temple."   They will want such attendees to seriously consider the active culture working in both FGS (Fo Guang Shan) AND the Boston-based FGSBT (basically, do you like it enough to 'become engaged' with it?).  Meals ARE vegan - always 100% vegan - but they DO NOT required veganism as 'a test of fellowship' - which means that they teach that veganism is desirable but not the first step to personal development.  Many on this list will not like that nuance.
2016 is "a new start" for FGS Boston Temple (FGSBT).
"New Starts" are believed to be interesting by the promoters of 'new starts' (consider the SDA-based NEWSTART program: Nutrition, Exercise, Water, Sunshine, Temperance, Air, Rest, Trust in God).

The next Dharma With Dinner will be on Friday night, May 20th, from 6:30-9:00 pm.  Ven. Jue Qian and Marjorie Jacobs, Training Associate at BU Center for Psychiatric Rehabilitation, will give an interactive presentation entitled Mindful Eating: A Daily Meditation Practice for Our Mind & Body. 

An opportunity to practice mindful eating and discover how to incorporate it into our everyday life to enhance our health and wellbeing will begin with (a) 30 minutes of Buddhist led meditation then (b) a vegan buffet (all costs - for materials and the practices - included in admission).

The evening will begin with
meditation from 6:30-7:00 
followed by dinner from 7:00-7:45 and
the presentation from 7:50-9:00. 

The fee for this event is $12 for adults and $8 for students/seniors.  That's for all OR part of the evening event.

Please register by an email reply - [masked])
no later than Thursday noon 
so that they will have a tentative number of who expects to attend both the dinner and the Dharma talk. 
We look forward to seeing you soon. 

With palms joined together,
marjorie for FGSBT Boston 

https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0/?ui=2&ik=adf2c21f8a&view=fimg&th=1548c5f8ccea7c5f&attid=0.1&disp=emb&realattid=ii_153f338cbbc968b3&attbid=ANGjdJ_Rp8-6zxlCPtSD5NEYVNOXhhUud0Ix1tebEdko1bMprF4dAu_IBwgZOCBiforJOEKWM99Qw9uyT5ZsXloIP6AlK4KBLWl-KQNFqUr2bh_Kqx7dxDtb7jdyJD4&sz=w946-h662&ats=1462645714921&rm=1548c5f8ccea7c5f&zw&atsh=1

Directions to
FGSBT Boston, 711 Concord Avenue, Cambridge, MA

There is parking available onsite.  The FGSBT site is diagonally across the street from Fresh Pond, a few blocks from both Neville Communities (assisted living and center for rehabilitation and nursing).   It is located on both the 74 and 75 bus lines, and that also is a 20-minute walk from the Red Line's Alewife stop.

This is a pretty nice place. They even have big goldfish, aka Koi!

Come enjoy our challenging miniature golf course, Koi fish pond with interactive feeding station and delicious ice cream at our concession stand – fun for kids and the young at heart! A  Groupon lightens the load. 

http://paradisefamilygolf.com/

https://www.groupon.com/deals/paradise-mini-golf-3-7


Choose Between Two Options$15 for a round of mini golf and small ice creams for two (up to $25 value)$30 for a round of mini golf and small ice creams for four (up to $51 value)

Paradise Mini Golf features a “Koi Pond” right next to the golf course, and is fun for all ages and groups.

Paradise Family Golf

At Paradise Family Golf, friends and families guide colorful golf balls through an 18-hole oasis of zigzagging putting greens and tropical obstacles. The course’s river exposes orbs to the treachery of a flowing stream on multiple holes, and a 35-foot-tall tree house gives local birds a chance to cheer on putt-putters or stock up on nourishing golf balls for winter's hibernation. After a round, golfers can stop by the koi pond and feed the fish at the feeding station or visit the ice-cream stand. Visitors looking to expand their golf game beyond the mini domain can drop by the Paradise Driving Range to hone lengthier swings. Other offerings include the golf simulator where you can choose from over 80 courses from around the world to play, TrackMan Performance Studio to help identify areas in your game you can improve, and putting green for practice in a variety of conditions and situations.

results.description:
Kangoo Jumps is one of the latest fitness crazes catching on across the country.  It's an amazing workout for people who are interested in losing weight and building strength. Great for those who want a high intensity cardio workout with far less impact to their joints. Kangoo jumps can burn up to 50% more calories than traditional workouts.

                                                    Meetup Details:


Organizer/Event Host:
Jenna  (Southeastern Hiking Club)

Kangoo Jumps Instructor:
Wendel C.

Sponsored by:
Kangoo Jumps Club - MA.


Choreography Level:
Easy, basic steps, entry level

Cardio Level:
High Intensity Workout

Location:
Abington/Weymouth Town Line, Rt 18, see exact address above

Cost:
$15.00 with Kangoo rental - $10.00 without rental, * Special rate pricing avail to SSH&B/SHC members only.


Attendance Limit:
15 members, limit may increase as needed later.

Gear/Clothing:
Bring 2 pairs of high thick socks, similar to those you would wear with roller blades or ski boots (wool or wicking). Wear supportive clothing, a good sports bra & bring water. 

Kangoo Rental Sizes:

Small - Womens 4-7 or Mens 3-6
Medium - Womens[masked] Mens[masked]
Large - Womens 10-12 Mens 9-11
XLarge - Womens 12+, Mens 12-15

Action Required After RSVP:
Please add your Kangoo size to the comments board so that I can arrange to have them onsite for the class.


Communications:
I'll arrive on site early and will use the meetup board to communicate. I'll send my contact info to those that RSVP. Please use text when contacting me if poss.


Misc but Important:
- We meet in the Zass Zumba Studio, look for the yellow sign in the strip mall

- Don't video tape anyone the without their consent, pics are fine

- Don't eat a full meal (or drink too much) up to an hour before class.

- Open lockers are right by the front door so leave your valuables in car or at home.

- Bring cash/exact change (if possible) to expedite 

- Bring a snack with you for the ride home.

- Zumba class lets out prior to the Kangoo classes, it may run a few minutes past the hour, it's ok to go inside and wait.

- You can not just show up at this event without an RSVP. Kangoos are brought to the location based on your RSVP & size + class size must be controlled due to type of activity. 

Prereqs:
Anyone with basic concepts of aerobics, step, boxing or zumba/dance and enjoys a high intensity cardio workout.

Future Kangoo Jump Events:
Kangoo jump weekend hikes will be posted to meetup under Southeastern Hiking Club (SHC) starting in May. 

Disclaimer:
During all events, everyone is responsible for themselves. Meetup hosts, organizers, assistant organizers, leaders, guides and sponsors are not responsible for the safety of participants. By joining the group, you acknowledge and agree to this statement.

results.description:
Join the third meeting of the growing HBS-Braintree as Eric Michael Cohen leads us in a discussion looking at how we tend to repeatedly self-sabotage our closest personal relationships... and what to do about it .

Our Topic This Evening We Will .... 

...  Explore what we do, why we do it and how to break the pattern so that our future relationships are healthier and more rewarding then the relationships in our past

To Prepare ....

1)  What pattern(s) do I seem to repeat again and again when I am in disagreement / conflict with my partner?


2) How does it feel physiologically (in my body) when I am stressed / triggered? (Pit in the stomach, lump in the throat, trouble thinking clearly, thoughts spinning, feeling trapped, feeling terrified, feeling paralyzed etc.) 

Our Leaders This Evening

This evening's leader is Eric.  

Eric Michael Cohen is a Marriage & Relationship Repair Specialist and Business, Career & Life Coach in private practice at The Life Lab Coaching Studio in Braintree. A veteran of many personal growth and introspective programs, Eric strives to increase harmony and restore conflict using an approach that balances paradigm shift, behavioral mindfulness and pragmatic skills. Separate from relationship and individual work, Eric's other interests include dogs, music and football.

Angela Nuss has read dozens of self-help books, including all three of Gretchen Rubin’s Happiness books.  She has implemented several strategies and will help introduce you to your own Happiness Project journey! Angela is licensed in Property & Casualty Insurance, owns her condo in Braintree, and has recently started 2 home-based businesses.

Angela is a positive outgoing person who continually strives to be a better, happier person and enjoys helping others immensely.  Angela has been organizing and hosting various events since she co-founded the Braintree High School Interact Club in 1993.  She received the Unsung Hero Award at Bentley College for events she organized, has hosted and organized hundreds of singles dating events, and is one of the longest-running Meetup.com organizers starting two of the first Meetup groups on the South Shore in the summer of 2006.

Barbara has been studying literature, philosophy and psychology her entire life, always working towards increasing knowledge and self awareness.  She believes everyone has the potential to change and improve their quality of life, no matter what the circumstances.  She has many years of experience working with people in the medical and mental health fields.  Her main passions include helping others, practicing yoga, reading and researching, nature, and animals.  This is her first time hosting a Meetup event, and she looks forward to seeing this group grow.

results.description:
For the week of Together 2016 festival we invite you to visit the Mmmmaven Recharge Lounge. It will open Monday, May 16th through the 22nd as your place to meet festival-goers and the Together team, listen to local DJs, power up, relax, and hydrate before the evening's festivities. Don't miss hands-on interactive workshops with leading music technology brands, like Novation, Ableton, and Denon more. Check out full schedule here.

For this session we invite you to bring along a vinyl record of your choice. Ableton’s Ben Casey will demonstrate how to sample it, chop it and turn it into something new in just 45 minutes using the sampling workflows in Ableton Push 2.

Ben Casey is a Brooklyn-based electronic musician, Ableton Certified Trainer, and overall music tech nerd. When he’s not surrounded by wires and drum machines or tinkering with Max for Live, Ben teaches Ableton Live to musicians across all genres, from avant-garde to zydeco.

While living in London he earned an MMUS from Goldsmiths University, and released tracks on the inscrutable UK-based label Werk Discs. Upon returning to the US, he founded a boutique electronic instrument business.

A Live user since its very beginning, Ben is always happy to show off his boxed copy of Version 1. He works with Grammy-winning artists to integrate Live into their existing production and performance workflows, consulting on numerous live tours, theater productions, and art installations.

With a focus on teaching the tips and tricks that allow musicians at any skill level to harness the power of Live, Ben is available for one-on-one sessions and group lessons in person, or Skype lessons worldwide.

</a>

Follow Together on <a href="https://twitter.com/together">Twitter, Instagram, & Facebook!
results.name: ABLETON PUSH SAMPLE CHALLENGE

results.description:
This looks kinda interesting; let's see where this story takes us.

We are going to the 8PM show for this.  I will be at the theater by 7 and we will head in for seats by 7:30.  The movie is showing upstairs, so we will gather at the tables by the windows at the top of the escalator.  Tickets are on sale now on Fandango.

In general, I arrive at the theater an hour before the show to start gathering people, and we head in for seats about 30 minutes before the show, so we can sit together. This also allows us to take turns getting snacks, etc., before the previews start.  It also allows for any unexpected, last minute changes at the theater.  Although fairly infrequent, having wiggle room to exchange tickets, etc. is VERY helpful.

Please note, everyone is responsible for buying their own tickets.  And while it is possible to buy your ticket at the door, shows often sell out. I strongly advise you to buy your tickets in advance. 

If you miss the group ahead of time, come find us after. We gather in the hallway outside of the theater we just saw the movie in, to discuss the film a bit, allow for restroom breaks and to get a head count of all those who would like to go out after for drinks and munchies.

$$$$Managing the after event is much easier if everyone brings cash, so please plan ahead if you want to go out with the group after.  We will be splitting one bill for the group. No separate checks.$$$

One more thing, please keep your rsvp's up to date so I can plan the after event and know who to look for.  Thanks!

Movie Details:

Release date: May 20, 2016

Studio: Warner Bros. Pictures

Director: Shane Black

MPAA Rating: R (for violence, sexuality, nudity, language and brief drug use)

Screenwriter: Shane Black

Starring: Russell Crowe, Ryan Gosling, Angourie Rice, Matt Bomer, Margaret Qualley, Keith David, Kim Basinger

Genre: Comedy, Action

Plot Summary:

Oscar winner Russell Crowe (“Gladiator,” “Man of Steel”) and Oscar nominee Ryan Gosling (“Half Nelson,” “The Big Short”) star in Silver Pictures’ action comedy “The Nice Guys,” from director Shane Black (“Kiss Kiss Bang Bang,” “Iron Man 3”). “The Nice Guys” takes place in 1970s Los Angeles, when down-on-his-luck private eye Holland March (Gosling) and hired enforcer Jackson Healy (Crowe) must work together to solve the case of a missing girl and the seemingly unrelated death of a porn star. During their investigation, they uncover a shocking conspiracy that reaches up to the highest circles of power.

results.description:
This is always a spiritually powerful evening!  You’ll be led through 2 guided meditations into easily connecting to and feeling your sense of spirit – the fullness of who you are, and then to bring it into various aspects of your life - your environments, behaviors, capabilities, beliefs and values, sense of self and your greater vision. This alone is a very powerful experience; but we’re going to take it even further.

From there, we’ll then do a guided process that will have you bringing this strong sense of spirit to problematic areas in your life and other contexts in which you want to feel your higher self present.

Just imagine feeling connected to your sense of your Spiritual self, and expanding that feeling more and more and more AND having it more available to you!  This is the key to powerfully using the law of attraction!

Please bring a journal or notebook and pen to class; and please plan on arriving a little early to get settled so we can begin on time.


So PLEASE find a way to join us!  Please share this with your e-mail lists and groups, your friends, and your family,and invite them to join you!

“Powerful guided meditations– empowering! Loved how each meditation was focused and built upon the other and prepared the spirit for the final circle meditation. Learned valuable techniques to incorporate into my daily meditations. Thanks Ann– great job leading the meditations.” Donna

To encourage and support your practice, if you pay for 4 classes, the fee will be only $60 (in-person, cash or check).  Or, you can pay for one class at a time for $20.  Just RSVP each time you want to attend. RSVP is recommended and appreciated, as well as showing up or changing your RSVP in a timely manner.


Class leader: Ann Ide, M.A., www.newpossibilitiescoaching.com, certified master practitioner in Neuro-linguistic Programming and Hypnotherapy, and certified NLP Life Coach. Ann coaches people to move beyond struggles and mere survival, to new levels of harmony, happiness and success. results.description:
Enjoy a leisurely moonlight paddle on the lake with like-hearted others.   Perhaps we'll visit the beaver lodges, maybe even see one going about its nocturnal busyness, or hear one slap its tail in warning. We'll quietly explore the lake, as we enjoy the evening air, the night sounds and the moonlight glimmering across the water. Then we'll return to shore, light the fire pit and enjoy toasted marshmallows and fine conversation.
We have canoes/kayak for eleven. You are also welcome to bring your own. It is possible to get wet, so having a change of clothes, especially shoes and socks, is a good idea. f you have a headlamp that would be helpful.
We look forward to celebrating each full moon throughout the summer this way.  Upcoming dates: 6/20, 7/19, 8/18, 9/16 and 10/16.
$20 suggested donation.

results.description:
Here is the exciting info on our next River Cruise! 

Our rep is offering an additional $50 off per person for any deposits received between now and at the meeting.  Reservation form will be posted above -under MORE/ FILES

Rhine May 2016 TRIP  

SPACE IS BASED ON AVAILABILITY - FIRST COME FIRST SERVE WITH A DEPOSIT

Sail date is May 21, 2016

8 DAY RIVER CRUISE FROM AMSTERDAM TO BASEL

One of Europe’s most legendary rivers awaits on this mesmerizing journey along the Rhine. Enjoy a canal cruise in splendid Amsterdam as well as guided sightseeing in Cologne, Koblenz, and Strasbourg. Delight in excursions to Germany’s Black Forest and to Heidelberg, Germany’s oldest university town with its imposing castle. Also sail through the dramatic Rhine Gorge, see the legendary Lorelei rock, and visit the Gutenberg Museum in Mainz.

Day-By-Day Itinerary

Day 1 Arrive In Amsterdam, Holland (Embarkation)

Welcome to Amsterdam! Holland’s sophisticated, modern capital has a rich and fascinating history. This delightful 700-year-old city with its elegant and classic architecture, cafés, and restaurants has a distinct ambiance. The streets, squares, and canals—not to mention the bike paths throughout the city—make for a vibrant atmosphere, and with over 60 museums, Amsterdam has the highest museum density in the world. Perhaps you would like to take an optional excursion to Zaanse Schans with its traditional houses and Dutch craft workshops. This afternoon, board your river cruise vessel and meet your crew at an evening welcome reception.(Dinner)

NOTE:
Guests must be on board ship by 5:00pm.Day 2Amsterdam

There is no better way to see Amsterdam than by CANAL BOAT, cruising through the elegant grachten lined with stately homes dating back to Amsterdam’s “Golden Age.” There’s free time in the city this afternoon—you might like to join an optional biking tour (weather permitting). Later, bid tot ziens (farewell) to Holland and set sail for Germany. (Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner)

Day 3   Cologne, Germany

Today, enjoy a peaceful morning of cruising before reaching Cologne in the afternoon. One of Germany’s largest cities and capital of the Rhineland, Cologne straddles both sides of the Rhine, and is known for its soaring, twin-steepled gothic cathedral. Choose between an included GUIDED CITY WALK or JEWISH HERITAGE WALK. The Old Town abounds with cafés, shops, and taverns. Be sure to try a Kölsch pale lager, locally brewed in Cologne for over a hundred years! (Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner)

Day 4  Koblenz–Rhine Gorge–Rüdesheim

Situated at the confluence of the Rhine and Moselle Rivers, 2,000-year-old Koblenz is the cultural and business center of the Middle Rhine region. Here, join a Local Guide for a WALKING TOUR of the city that reveals an eventful past through its castles, fortress walls, towers, squares, and monuments. The dramatic RHINE GORGE is the most beautiful stretch of river. Here, ancient castles stand sentry on lofty cliffs rising 400 feet above the waters. Cruise past the legendary rock of the Lorelei, where echoes of enchanted siren song lured unwitting sailors to their doom. In Rüdesheim, the quintessential Rhine Valley wine town, visit SIEGFRIED’S MECHANICAL MUSICAL INSTRUMENT MUSEUM to see and hear a large collection of self-playing calliopes and music boxes from the 18th to the early 20th centuries. Enjoy a SPECIAL TREAT before returning to your ship for dinner. (Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner)

Day 5  Mainz. Excursion To Heidelberg

Strategically located at the confluence of the Rhine and Main Rivers is Mainz, with “civilized” origins dating back to around 38 BC. Today, this is Germany’s largest and most important wine market. Join your Local Guide for a GUIDED WALK through the Altstadt (Old Town) with its many intriguing shops and the whimsical Fastnachtsbrunnen (Carnival Fountain) on the Schillerplatz, a tribute to the jesters at the city’s annual Carnival celebration. Gutenberg, father of modern printing, was born here, and you’ll visit the captivating GUTENBERG MUSEUM. After lunch, travel to Heidelberg, home to the oldest university in Germany. With a LOCAL GUIDE, visit the imposing ruins of HEIDELBERG CASTLE, towering magnificently over the city and among the most important Renaissance structures north of the Alps. You’ll also see the famed GREAT VAT, the “World’s Largest Wine Barrel.” At nearly 23 feet high and 28 feet wide, the cask holds over 58,000 gallons of wine and has a dance floor built on top of it! (Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner)

Day 6  Strasbourg, France

Situated on the border of France and Germany, Strasbourg blends the cultures of both countries in a delightful way. As capital of the Alsace region and seat of the Council of Europe and European Parliament, it is without a doubt an important city that manages to retain its historic charm. On your GUIDED SIGHTSEEING TOUR, visit the monumental red-sandstone GOTHIC CATHEDRAL with its ancient murals, stained-glass windows, and fascinating astronomical clock, as well as the magical LA PETITE FRANCE district, home to half-timber houses, quaint shops, inviting bistros, and a waterfront promenade. Also spend time exploring Place Kléber, a large historic square in the heart of the city, and Place Gutenberg in the heart of medieval Strasbourg, which features a statue of the inventor of the printing press. An optional excursion into the Alsace wine country is available today. After dinner tonight, enjoy an onboard WOODCARVING demonstration. (Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner)

Day 7  Breisach, Germany. Excursion To The Black Forest

Located at the foot of Kaiserstuhl Mountain on the French-German border, Breisach is the gateway to Germany’s BLACK FOREST region, an area of unrivaled natural beauty with its forests of thick pine trees. The area got its name because the forests are so dense that local residents described them as black. Surely the most well-known products from this region are Black Forest ham, Black Forest cherry cake, and cuckoo clocks. You may opt for a visit to the workshop of a local woodcarver who produces clocks and other carvings, or to the open-air Museum of Vogtsbauernhof to see how life was lived in this area centuries ago. (Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner)

Day 8 Basel, Switzerland (Disembarkation)

Your vacation ends with breakfast this morning. (Breakfast)

NOTE:
Departure flights home should not leave Zürich Airport before 10:00am.


The ship is the new Tranquility II - built in April 2015

Tranquility II

Another exciting Suite Ship® graces the rivers of Europe in 2015. The intimate setting of the Avalon Tranquility II features two full decks of Panorama Suites with Wall-to-Wall Panoramic Windows that transform the living space into a unique Open-Air Balcony®. With 200 square feet, Panorama Suites are more than 30% larger than the industry standard-perfect for stretching out and relaxing-or even throwing a private cocktail party for up to six adults in the spacious sitting area. Onboard amenities and services include a complimentary Internet Corner and free Wi-Fi access, a Fitness Center with state-of-the-art equipment, a hair salon, elevator, and a spacious Sky Deck with shade system, whirlpool, deck games, and the delightful Sky Bistro for al-fresco lunches of light grill fare.

results.description:
Our culture and conditioning tell us that the best way to fulfill our desires is through directed effort and goal setting. It’s super hard work, but we convince ourselves it’s worth it because it’s the only way to get what we want. But what if that’s not always true? You’ve had those experiences of getting to the long-awaited goal, only to find that it feels empty. All the longing and struggle to get there left you tired and wondering what happened. I got there! I did the thing! Why doesn’t if feel like I thought it would?


What if the formula is the problem? What if instead the surest path to your heart’s desire is something counterintuitive and that turns our cultural conditioning inside out? What if the surest path to fulfillment of desires is surrender?

"Surrender is faith that the power of Love can accomplish anything even when you cannot foresee the outcome."
- Deepak Chopra

People who practice Orgasmic Meditation (OM) discover that they suddenly have much more ability to feel, know, and access their desires. They also experientially discover the power of surrender. David Freeman, an OM practitioner since 2014 and graduate of the OneTaste Coaching program, learned first hand the role of surrender in letting his desires flourish beyond his wildest dreams when he decided to create and lead the first OM retreat in Costa Rica. David is a wolf at heart: powerful, clever, and a skilled hunter of that which he desires. He uses his wolf alchemy to help others discover the seeds of their desires, plant them in fertile soil, and then through true surrender, encourage those desires to flourish.

In this talk, David shares his experiences and learnings, his walk along the path of Orgasmic Meditation, and the impact of his practice on his work and life.

He will also briefly describe the practice of Orgasmic Meditation, and if you discover desire to go deeper, you can register for the Intro to OM class on Saturday, May 21, 1 - 5 PM, with a special rate when you register at the lecture.

This is an interactive evening you won’t want to miss! You will come away with a new way to access and work with desire—one that replaces struggle with joy!

FREE!
Friday, May 20, 7:30 - 8:30 PM
Boston OM Center
50 Dudley Street, Cambridge
results.name: From Struggle to Surrender:  A Surprising Way to Fulfill Your Heart’s Desires
