We'll walk in the woods, spend time with like-hearted others and the natural world. MariePatrice and John will guide us in listening and observing, exploring  how nature inspires us and what it may be reflecting back to us.

Although, this is more of a meditative walk than a hike, we may walk up to three miles. So wear appropriate shoes. The terrain is mostly flat, unless we go down the hill to the lake shore. Best to assume there are ticks, although I have never picked up a tick walking these trails.

results.description:
Monthly Classes  The 5 Rhythms and Conscious Relating

MONTHLY CLASSES RETURN
Sunday, May 22

The 5 Rhythms & Conscious Relating

...

The Arts at the Armory 191 Highland Street Somerville
4th Sunday (some 3rd) of the month beginning May 22
10am-12noon
4th Sundays,June 26, July 24 (August 28?) September 25,
3rd Sundays,October 16, Nov 20

The 5 Rhythms ® creator of a movement revolution offer an invitation to just come as you are.
We join in with joy, broken hearts, fragile knees, smiles and tears, estatic awarness or feeling lost. We are a prism of all things.
No dance experience needed, just your curiosity as a first step to awareness through movement and deeper conscious connection to ourselves and others. Sweat Your Prayers baby!

Conscious Relating asks, have you ever stopped yourself from speaking your truth, because you were shy or did not want to bother the other person in anyway? Have you wanted to really be able to listen to another's words with out thinking ahead with what you may say back? Movement is such a strong clearing energy that gets us back into our bodies with clarity. Let us dance together and consciously relate  with movement and  our voices.
 In this class we are welcomed back to the heartbeat of our feet as we find exquisite energy flowing in our bodies. An expressive and honoring body warm up, we fine tune our truth in the moment.
The 5 Rhythms:
Flowing- discover
Staccato-define
Chaos- dissolve
Lyrical- disappear
Stillness- detach
are maps that will guide us into conscious journeys we long to take.
go to www.Margauxskalecki.com for the PAYPAL link
$13- $20

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Margaux Skalecki  BFA Dance,  MA Expressive Therapies and Performance Arts has  served  the New England community bringing The 5 Rhythms forward since 1997. She is a  5 Rhythms Certified WAVES  (2001) and HEARTBEAT (2015) She is a  faculty member for numerous schools and studios teaching children and adults. As an ERegistered 500 hour yoga teacher, Margaux created Dancing Prana Yoga  which melts dance into the asanas of yoga.  She is a Reiki Master, a Commissioned  Healer of the Spiritualist Churches, an Animal Communicator a a Medium Intuitive Coach and  a Shamanic Agent of Change

results.description:
Follow this link to register for Foraging for Lunch in the Permaculture Garden and don't forget to RSVP on this Meetup page too.

Wild and cultivated vegetables will be harvested and prepared for a delicious mid-day meal with well known herbalist and healer Margi Flint.

Discussion of nutritional and medicinal benefits of the plants will be shared. Join in preparation of our meal and eat togeather while answering additional questions and sharing stories of plants.

About Margi Flint: Margi Flint practices in the seacoast town of Marblehead, Massachusetts and over the past forty years has become their “village herbalist.” Margi has been Adjunct Professor at North Shore Community College, The Tufts University School of Medicine and currently at Massachusetts College of Pharmacy and Pacific Rim College in British Columbia. She lectures in Canada, Europe and the States (so far). Find out more about her practice at earthsongherbals.com.

About iFarm: ifarm utilizes a restored 19th century farmstead to reconnect the individual with the earth. The goal is to provide diverse educational experiences that utilize core values of sustainability, rejuvenation, and thoughtful design which both individuals and communities can incorporate into their own environment, experiences and life.
results.name: Foraging for Lunch in the Permaculture Garden with Margi Flint

results.description:
Learn how to sail on the Charles River! What better way is there to enjoy Boston than on the water--sailing, kayaking, paddleboarding, or windsurfing? And all for an affordable price, even cheaper than your typical gym or yoga studio.

Community Boating Inc. Boston, MA will be hosting our FINAL FREE Spring Open House for prospective and new members on Sunday, May 22nd from 10am until 2pm.

10AM: Free Orientation followed by free skippered sailboat rides

11AM: Free Orientation followed by free skippered sailboat rides

12PM: Cookout & Free Orientation followed by free skippered sailboat rides

1PM: Free Orientation followed by free skippered sailboat rides

All free Orientations run on the hour, every hour at 10AM, 11AM, 12PM, and 1PM (please be on time, only offered on the hour, every hour), to be followed by FREE skippered sailboat rides for new members or those attending the Orientation classes. 

*Non-members must arrive to Orientation on time & fill out the guest form in advance for the skippered sail: www.community-boating.org/guest.* Please dress appropriately if you are interested in the sailboat rides (proper shoes and proper layers). 

Purchase an Adult Full Year Membership in-person during the Open House and receive FREE guest privileges, plus we'll take you straight out for an introductory skippered sailboat ride on the Charles! Your Full Year membership grants you access to all the classes that we offer, special discounts to CBI events, and usage of all the boats and equipment.

Enjoy Polar Seltzer and Starbucks coffee, and an afternoon cookout at noon, featuring Kayem hot dogs and other snacks.

Can't make it to the Open House? We also offer a daily FREE Orientation class at 5:45PM for prospective members to learn about all that Community Boating has to offer. Just drop on by any time.

results.description:
Every Sunday at 10:30 AM we gather in our Sunday Circle, a time for gratitude,  prayer, song, and reflection.  Anyone is welcome to simply come as you are to any of these gatherings.  Please join us if you are seeking a time of centering, transformation, and connection with other people on their spiritual journeys. 

In the Sunday Circles we embody a rootedness in a Christian faith that is open to all faiths.  Our minister, Rev. Dr. Ian Mevorach, often preaches a dialogue sermon that invites the insights and wisdom of all who are gathered.   Other ministers, members of the community, or special guests also take turns leading our circles. Themes of spirituality, social and environmental justice, openness and love are at the core. We often engage in interfaith dialogue. We discuss scriptures from the Bible and other sacred texts, as well as explore poetry, music, and other sources of inspiration.  Every first Sunday of the month we celebrate an inclusive communion that is open to all.

Ou Sunday Circles are a time and place where people come together in a sacred way and where various threads in our community are often woven together into a greater whole.
results.how_to_find_us: Our building is located on Common Street overlooking the town green in Natick Center.  Parking in side and back lots.
results.name: Join us for our Sunday Circle time of gratitude, reflection, song and prayer

We are haulin now. A mini Stonehenge? S.O.S. II bigtime.

http://www.thetrustees.org/places-to-visit/north-shore/ward-reservation.html


About Ward Reservation

Climb a hill for great views extending from the surrounding Merrimack Valley to the Boston skyline, or explore this sprawling landscape along almost 10 miles of trails. 

What makes the Ward Reservation a special place? 
Credit Mabel Ward for her foresight, generosity, and enduring love. In 1940, seven years after the death of her husband, Charles W. Ward, she paid tribute to his memory and their union by making an original donation of 153 acres to The Trustees. In ensuing years, the Ward family and others have made additional gifts; the reservation now totals 700 acres. 

Trails link three major hills – Shrub, Boston, and Holt – and looking out from their summits you can see how the property melds with the surrounding landscape. The “Solstice Stones” mark the grassy summit of Holt Hill, the highest point in Essex County. This compass-like arrangement of stones indicates the cardinal points on the compass, the points of the summer and winter solstices, and the points of the spring and autumnal equinoxes. 

At the base of Holt Hill, step onto a boardwalk that leads to Pine Hole Pond, at which point you may ask: Is this water or land? In fact, you are walking across a rare quaking bog, comprised of concentric rings of floating vegetation, each with unique growing conditions. The bog is home to a number of interesting plant species, including orchids and insect-eating pitcher plants. Stop at the numbered stations along the way, each of which signals an interesting botanical or geologic feature. Pick up an interpretive booklet at the bulletin board to follow numbered stations along the boardwalk and learn more about this rare natural phenomenon. 

Trails
Almost 10 miles of trails, easy-to-moderate hiking, strenuous in places. Some of the trails here are part of the Bay Circuit Trail, a regional greenway linking the North Shore and South Shore. 

When to Visit
Year-round, daily, 8am to sunset. Allow a minimum of 2 hours.
results.name: Charles Ward Reservation (a true Walk a Bout, 704 acres) - Andover, MA -

results.description:
WARNING: the meet up time now varies from week to week. if you can't make it, make sure you change your RSVP to No, such that someone else can take your spot.

We have rented 3 badminton courts at the BU Fitness & Recreation Center (regulation full sized courts).  The BU facility is immaculate and a fantastic place to play.


The fee (payable online when you RSVP) gets you into the BU Fitness & Recreation Center to play badminton for an hour and a half.  Part of the fee is for the court time and the rest is for your meetup group to cover other expenses, i.e. rackets, shuttlecocks/birdies, meetup.com fees. All fees collected go to pay the Group's expenses.

We have rackets and shuttles for everyone!

Expect to play doubles. The host can help to match up pairs but members are free to join in any game they want.  The courts are reserved only for Boston Badminton members.

Before asking a question, please read through the following FAQs:

Q: The meetup is full, can I come regardless and pay at the event?
A: No, there is limited space to make sure everyone gets to play. A few spots typically open up before the event.

Q: It's my first time, how do I find you?
A: Go to the BU Fitness & Recreation Center reception (see directions below), and tell them you're here with Boston Badminton. They'll tell you where the courts are, check you're on the list, and make you sign a waiver. The meeting point is on the courts.

Q: I am a BU student, do I get a discount?
A: No, BU charges us the same regardless of whether participants are at BU or not.


Directions:
Please click here for a google map to The BU Fitness & Recreation Center.  The easiest way to get to the FitRec center from within Boston is to take the Green Line (B)-Boston College to Saint Paul St.  Parking is limited but available.  Please click here for parking information.

Plan to grab a drink locally after if we have interest.

The club has full locker room and shower facilities.

Note: In addition to agreeing to the Meetup's Liability Waiver, all members must sign a Waiver of Liability Form in order to use BU's courts. This form is available at the front desk at the FitRec center.  We may ask you for your full name in order to help BU and the meetup comply with the liability procedures.

Let me know if you have any questions and I hope to see you there!

Liability Waiver

The purpose of the following Liability Waiver is to protect Boston Badminton meetup members and group leaders from liability in case of accident or injury. All members must agree to the Liability Waiver in order to participate in the group and its activities.

In consideration of the opportunity to participate in events, activities, classes, and programs conducted by Boston Badminton and its affiliates in any venue, and to use equipment located therein, I, on behalf of myself and my minor children, do hereby release, hold harmless and forever discharge and agree not to sue Boston Badminton and its trustees, officers, agents, founders, members, volunteers and employees (together, "Meetup.com Group") from any and all claims, responsibilities or liabilities for injury or damages resulting from or arising out of my or my family’s use of, presence in, or participation in activities conducted at any venue rented or owned by Boston Badminton, whether or not caused by the ordinary negligence of Boston Badminton. I also acknowledge that it is my responsibility to follow instructions for any activity or use of equipment, and to seek help from the volunteers if I have any questions. results.description:
Callahan is a pleasant small park located in northern Framingham MA. It has a variety of terrain; but it's mostly wooded. There is a half-mile long earthen dam to protect against flooding; it makes for a very level trail. There are several hills, and one will get your heart pumping.

I suggest trails that take us around the edge of the southern half of the park. It's about 4 miles, about 2-3 hours. There are many crisscrossing trails to make the hike shorter; and there's the northern half of the park to make the hike longer.


We will meet in the Edmunds Road parking lot. It's a large lot that will hold many cars. Google says the coordinates are 42°19'53.0"N 71°28'31.7"W. The area is lots of small roads; so use a GPS device, or map your route ahead of time.


I recommend carrying footwear, just in case, if you're not sure of your capabilities, or you're still acclimating after the winter. The trail is typical of New England. Grass, dirt, mud, rocks, and roots. There's some gravel. A few months ago, brush, branches, and trees were shredded along the underground gas pipeline; the area looks devastated; but it did leave an interesting surface for barefoot hiking.

http://www.mass.gov/eea/agencies/dcr/massparks/region-north/callahan-state-park.html
results.name: Callahan State Park

results.description:
"The camera is an instrument that teaches people how to see without a camera."Dorothea Lange Join this workshop to discover the three secrets of creating stunning macro images. If you compose your self before your compose the image, you are certain to succeed. By the end of the class you will be more confident in your creative vision and able to take macro images that are in sharp focus and properly exposed. 

This Sunday afternoon I am combining my two favorite topics in one special photo opportunity:  Macro Photography and Mindfulness. Get ready to go slow, see deeply and experience a shift in how you perceive the beauty of life. I am opening my art studio at the the Boston Center for the Arts just for you so you can discover how to take stunning macro and closeup photos.

 About your instructor: Suzanne Merritt is a master level instructor with a studio at the Boston Center for the Arts. She has led workshops on beauty, photography, and creativity in Asia, Europe and the United States for the past 20 years. She was the founder of the Polaroid Creativity Lab and in 2016 opened The Curious Soul Photo School in Boston MA.   website: curioussoulphotos.com see more of photography by suzanne and subscribe to her blog for inspiring tips. 


This is a rain or shine event. We will work inside my studio building and if weather permits we will have an exercise out in the South End. If you have already taken this class, you are welcome to attend again. I will provide some new assignments for you so you can continue to hone your macro skills.

Close up of paint applying rule of thirds for interesting composition. 

If you have a macro lens, this is the perfect time to break it out and really learn how to use it to full advantage. If you don't have a macro lens fear not! You can use the close up/flower setting on your camera. If you have a tripod great to bring it. 

Before you can really connect, you need to shift into a more contemplative mindset. I will guide you through some simple mindfulness exercises you can use anytime any where to help you slow down and be more present. These simple techniques will immediately open your eyes to more subtle qualities of color, light, texture and shape that usually go unnoticed. Macro requires patience and deep seeing. 

Bokeh Technique: Japanese aesthetic of blurring the background so your subject captivates our attention and appreciation. This will be one of the techniques I will introduce during the workshop.

What you will learn during this workshop:

• How to enter the "flow" state using mindful breathing techniques to be patient and slow down.

• What camera settings are best for macro photography

• How to create the Bokeh effect and blur the background

• How to make sure your subject is in sharp focus

• How to use CREATIVE COMPOSITION for added impact

• How to shoot nature and man made object using available light


 (I will bring flowers for the shoot.)

Photo in my studio by former class participant Rahul Great use of shallow depth of field. One secret of successful macro is to play with the scale of the object. We don't know if this is something big or small. But we know it is wonderful and magical. 

You will also receive lesson cards summarizing the content of the class and assignments so you can practice again on your own after the workshop. And I will provide individual guidance and feedback both during and after the class. 


Tuition for this four hour workshop is $45. 

I am limiting this class to 10 participants so please RSVP now if you would like a space. I am really looking forward to offering this workshop. After class we will go next door to the Beehive for refreshments if you would like to join us for the social time.

Blue Nets catching shadows and light. Suzanne Merritt

A beautiful macro, like a beautiful abstract makes you first respond to the visual quality and then wonder what it is. Wow I love it, what is it? This has fascinating details and deep depth of field that draws us in and engages our attention. 

Once you signup you will receive a more detailed email from me about what to bring, what to wear, and how to prepare. We are going to have a great time so I hope you will join us for this go slow, photo workshop! All levels are welcome and any camera will work just fine as long as it has a close up setting.


Join us for this relaxing, inspiring experience. You will meet great people and discover how to take better pictures. All you need to do is RSVP now.

See you Sunday 1:00 pm. You have joined the group, now join the fun!

Suzanne

Sneak Peek: My studio beautiful at the Boston Center for the Arts in the South End. Packed with fascinating object to photograph. My studio is your studio for the day.

http://itunes.apple.com/us/book/flow-tography-better-photos/id499049037?mt=11&uo=4  Click here to see more details about my book if you have an iPad.

website: curioussoulphotos.com see more of photography by suzanne and subscribe to her blog for inspiring tips.

If go, the walk will end at Goodies Ice Cream Shoppe (46 Maple St) for deserved treats.

Plenty of spaces still available. The Nurse Homestead alone is a bucket list item that all North Shore residents should cross off.

Unbeknownst to most tourists visiting Salem, the early events of the Witchcraft Hysteria of 1692 took place NOT in Salem but in Danvers, then called Salem Village. The initial accusations and examinations and arrests were in Salem Village. Only later did the action move to Salem Town, now City of Salem, for the trials downtown and executions on Proctor's Ledge.


This walk will visit the extant sites associated with the horrible events of 1692: the Rebecca Nurse Homestead and Graveyard; the Salem Village Witchcraft Victims Memorial; the Salem Village Parsonage archaeological site; the Samuel Holten house.


We begin at Danvers Town Hall, itself of historic significance, proceed west along Holten St, north along Centre St, returning east along Hobart St back to central Danvers. The total length of the walk will be about 4 miles, so be prepared.

This walk is my first effort outside the comfort zone of Salem, so much for me to learn. Any suggestions for other sites to pause in front off along the route, or for a place in Central Danvers to eat and relax after the walk, would be much appreciated.
results.how_to_find_us: At the War Memorial in front of Town Hall
results.name: Historic Danvers Walk

results.description:
Hey everyone,

This week we are going to meet to talk about Coen brothers films! Generally its rare to find films being co-directed but these guys have made a career of it! They have made comedies, horror, historical and dramas. However, whatever movie you watch you definitely always see their style.

We will get the conversation going with Fargo and Inside Llewyn Davis but we will likely move on to other movies. So watch those movies if you can but really having knowledge of their movies will be enough as well. 

Which genre do you think they do better? What you think about their oscar winning movies? Has their style of directing changed?

See you guys at renders on sunday!
results.how_to_find_us: Checknthe comment section closer to the meetup time
results.name: Film Discussion Topic: Coen Brothers Films!

results.description:
By signing up you agree to and have read the Mosaic Outdoor Mountain Club release of Liability. To read waiver please go to the Mosaic Pages of our website.


This hike is for those who asked for more elevation on the last hike. 

We will hike the Red Dot Trail to BUCK HILL, pause there to rest and enjoy the view, and then follow the Blue Skyline Trail (steep rocky hills) back.  The hike is approximately 4 miles total, and includes going up and down 3 steep, rocky hills (the Skyline part of the hike): Buck (492'), Boyce (377'), and Tucker (436'). Giving the feeling of a climbing small mountain in our own backyard.
The pace will be moderate, so if you are looking for a slow walk this is not the hike for you.
We will wait for everyone on this hike, so the pace of the hike will be held to that of the slowest hiker. If you break away from the Group at any point and hike ahead of us, then you are on your own. I will be on point and we will stay together as a Group.
Please make sure you are wearing appropriate shoes - hiking boots (we will cross three streams!). Remember to bring energy snacks to keep your endurance up, and plenty of water.
No dogs are allowed on this hike.
Contact Mike: I will post my cell# Saturday night.

 If anyone is like me and considers this hike a warmup and has the time. We could do the north/south loop to the tower.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the kiddie playground at Houghton's Pond Parking lot.
results.name: Moderate Paced Red Dot trail to Buck Hill

results.description:
Lets sketch the absurd amount of construction going on in the Seaport area. If the sky opens up, we shall retreat to the free portions of the ICA: the cafe, under the canopy, the lobby.


This neighborhood contains an interesting mix of historic and brand new buildings; industrial and residential, regular and irregular shapes. We can spend a little time documenting and observing the incredible state of transformation that this area is going through. I challenge the group to disperse far and wide to capture the diversity of conditions around here.

We will meet at 1pm at the park tables if it is pleasant, and in the ICA lobby if it is not. We will disperse to sketch, and reconvene at 3pm at the meeting point to share and discuss the work.

Mini-workshop: I will spend the first fifteen or twenty minutes talking about how I like to set up scenes, focal points, and perspective (constructed & atmospheric), and how that affects my rendering of buildings, either as background or foreground. If I have my act together, maybe there will be a handout or digital file.

http://www.gibsonsothebysrealty.com/blog/2013/05/09/boston-seaport-district-seaport-square-making-progress/
results.how_to_find_us: Chris will have a bright orange jacket (206) 349-3669
results.name: let's Sketch! Seaport Development Zone (with mini-workshop)

results.description:
Join us for our first annual Harvey Milk Day talk with Executive director of the AIDS Action Committee of Massachusetts, Carl Sciortino. 


Harvey Milk is famously quoted as saying "you gotta give them hope" and "hope is never silent." That message desperately and defiantly morphed into a declaration that "Silence=Death" by early AIDS activists. As an openly gay former lawmaker, and a person living with HIV himself, Carl will discuss where we are in confronting and overcoming the silence and stigma surrounding HIV more than three decades into this epidemic.


***
Carl Sciortino is the Executive Director of AIDS Action Committee. Until early 2014, he was a state representative in the Massachusetts Legislature. There, he was the leading legislative advocate on HIV-related legislation. These include measures to increase funding for HIV-related services; a bill that would require health insurers to cover the costs of treatment of lipodistrophy; and a law that expands HIV testing in Massachusetts. Sciortino, who is living with HIV, has championed social justice issues throughout his career, including the right of same-sex couples to marry; banning discrimination against transgender people; expanding access to health care; and increasing resources for anti-poverty programs. He received his Bachelor of Science from Tufts University and earned his Masters in Public Administration at the Kennedy School of Government at Harvard University.
results.name: Carl Sciortino: Harvey Milk Day Lecture: Hope, Silence, and a Virus: HIV in 2016

results.description:
Groups are wonderful! They help bolster your commitment and motivation, they supply you with opportunities to get ahead on your journey, and they provide support from the other members.
But when it comes to EFT, groups are even more wonderful! Not only is there a synergy created between the tappers increasing the potency of healing received, but even when the tapping isn't related to your particular problem, you still bet to borrow benefits from it!

Note that the amount of people allowed in the tapping circle is limited to 10. If you need to cancel your reservation, please do so at least 3 days in advance so that someone else can come in to the event...

Please arrive early. Doors will open 15 minutes ahead of time and the tapping circle will begin promptly at 2 pm. Late comers will not be allowed in. A late arrival not only disrupts the flow of the circle, shatters the feeling of safety so necessary in healing work, but can also prevent the facilitator from pacing the circle well.

Fee: $20 in advance, $25 at the door.

See you soon!

results.description:
Tickets available at https://www.eventbrite.com/e/games-and-contemporary-artificial-intelligence-tickets-24487632167

fShareX Youth Program proudly presents

Games and Contemporary Artificial Intelligence

The recent victory of a computer go program, Alpha Go, by DeepMind was an exciting moment in the evolution of artificial intelligence and another victory for neural networks. Join us as we celebrate by giving a talk on games and AI. 

We'll start by learning how to play the game of Go, discuss the working of the AI program that beat the Korean champion Lee Sedol 4-1, and DeepMind's prior AI that learned to play Atari games at superhuman levels. Next, we'll discuss how an AI based on a similar technique is used in the citizen science game Eyewire (eyewire.org) to advance neuroscience. We'll also solicit in advance suggestions for modern video game AIs to dissect to show what the current state of the art looks like.  

The program is targeted at high school students aged 13 to 16. Free GO boards (valued at $30) and light snacks will be provided.

Speaker Biography

Will Silversmith is a gold league Starcraft II player and lead developer for the citizen science game Eyewire. He has an interest in the intersection of neuroscience and AI. Will has previously helped exhibit a neuroscience virtual reality at TED 2014, and given a talk on Eyewire's AI previously at the 2015 Deep Learning Summit in Boston. He has previously given a talk on game design and modern technologies for fShareX. In his spare time, he does amateur photography, makes silly websites, and hopes that AI won't take over Starcraft as well.
results.how_to_find_us: Parking is available at South Station Terminal Parking for $9.
results.name: Games and Contemporary Artificial Intelligence

results.description:
18xx games are about railroads: building track and running trains for profit. 18xx games are also about a stock market, and the skullduggery between various robber barons as they try to build, thwart, take over, or bankrupt companies. But, they can take quite a while to play. We play with poker chips and emphasize a "ready to play" culture (meaning you're ready to act when your company is up). Games have generally taken from 2 hours (via bankruptcy) to 6 hours (to the end) with the average around 5 hours, even with new players. The more you plan in advance, the faster the game (of course, many times the other robber barons thwart your plans!)

You will need to be ready to start right at the starting time, or very close to it, because the game is so long. We also are splitting into two games quite frequently now so being early is better so we can decide which 18xx games to play and then have to set them up, unless we ALL can come to a pre-arrangement in the comments.

New players are welcome although we strongly suggest familiarizing yourself with the basic rules and concepts first. A brand new player will need 20 to 40 minutes of rules explanation before they play. The game really isn't overly complex, rules-wise, it's just long with lots of decisions. It is a little fiddly sometimes, though.

Due to some late arrivals in prior months, we will emphasize: If you're over 15 minutes late and have not made arrangements with one of the tables, you are probably only going to be a mere spectator, unless there is a game doing a rules explanation, you know that 18xx variant well, and can make it before it starts. If you're much later you probably won't be able to join a game at all. It usually takes us all afternoon and well into the evening to play one game of 18xx. Even our more "experienced" tables usually drop four or five hours into a single game (or more; last month we didn't finish either 1835 or 1830 until 9:30 PM or later). It is rare that there is a second game.

Also since we usually know the people in the week or so prior it will be good at that point if we can sort out what games we want to play in advance. While it's no guarantee we can break down that way, knowing to set up something in advance is SUPER helpful and time saving. Setting up and teaching a new 18xx variant can take an hour or more and the games are quite long as it is, so every little bit helps. What you need to know about 334 Mass Ave:

-Press 999 on the intercom and security will let you into the building
-You must sign in at the security desk with a picture ID
-Take the elevator down to level "A." Exit the elevator to your left and the community room will be ahead on your right, next to the laundry room.
results.name: May 18xx

results.description:
How many times have you walked through Downtown Crossing or Beacon Hill and actually taken time to really appreciate how beautiful it is? With this Scavenger Hunt you will not only get to appreciate one of  Boston's most iconic buildings, but you will get to meet dozens of interesting group members and friends in a fun and casual way.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$15 - PRE-PAY HERE:

http://scavbos.eventbrite.com

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Come alone or with a friend and we will team you up with others attending.  Enjoy a cocktail or cup of coffee with the group then we will send you out on your adventure.

Each team will have 75 minutes to complete the scavenger hunt with a list of items you must photograph and bring back with you to the bar.

Make sure you have a phone with a camera!

The teams with items will win prizes.( Amex Gift Cards, Drinks at Scholars)

Following the hunt you can stay at Scholars for our member Happy Hour

Cost: $15  - Includes light food served before and after the Hunt, nametags, item printouts, and prizes

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$15 - PRE-PAY HERE:

http://scavbos.eventbrite.com

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

SCHEDULE:

3-3:45 - Arrival, check in, mingle, team assignment and rules review

3:45 - You're off on The Hunt!

3:45-5:30 - The Hunt Continues

5:30 - You arrive back at Scholars to see which team found the most items

6:30 - Member Happy Hour ( Scavenger Hunt gets members free admission)

Level: No prior knowledge needed of anything… just have fun.

What to wear: dress for the weather

Can I come alone?  Yes 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.  We will team you up with other fun people.

Age Range - Open to all ages (average age range will be 25-45)

Can I put a team together myself? Absolutely. Just be sure you either register for your whole team or that they register in advance themselves.
results.name: Scavenger Hunt!

PARTICIPANTS ONLY (no unauthorized spectators or instructors) 

            Instruction by Boston's own Step Brother Taqwa;                                                     the Instructor who gave you James (Happy Feet) Brown, The Award Winning TRUE CHI-STEPPER DEMO DANCE TROUPE, and more of Greater Boston's most colorful Steppers.

TRUE CHI STEPPER 101, STRUCTURED CURRICULUM: 90 minutes of clinical instruction, followed by 30 minutes practice session, designed to have the average student stepping with universal proficiency in 8 weeks. Registration (limited to 20 ) available now via RSVP here for our Spring into Summer sessions. First come first serve. For any questions, please feel free to call Step Bro. Taqwa @[masked]

For best results, it's best to attend all 8 classes, and notebooks are highly encouraged. This a class is for new and beginner level Steppers, and those who understand that basic foundation can always use refinement to excel in the dance. 

FOUNDATION RULES OF PROPER CLASS ETIQUETTE: 

1. PLEASE BE ON TIME: Class begins Promptly @ 3 pm Punctuality is a gesture of respect (No "CP time" please!) 

2. SPIRIT OF A STUDENT: Adhere to the in-class instruction and correction by the Instructor and/or His designee, and the finished product of  your dance will be universal. (The humble calf drinks the most milk.) 

3. STICK TO THE CURRICULUM: There will be no deviation from the curriculum. For those desiring special instructions not included in this 101 curriculum. private lessons are available by appointment.

4. RESPECT FOR INSTRUCTOR AND CLASSMATES IS A MUST: While class is in session, sidebar conversations are a source of distraction and should be had outside the dance studio.

By attending this class, it is understood that you have read, understand, and agree to the rules of etiquette, you are fit for vigorous exercise, you and hold Steppin In The Bean, and Saint Mary's Episcopal Church blameless for any resulting injury that may occur.

$10 pp.        RSVP highly encouraged
results.name: STEPPIN SUNDAYS @ SAINT MARY,S

results.description: This gathering is for anyone who is yearning to be among kindred hearts for both giving and receiving support, ideas, and encouragement related to these extraordinary times of personal and planetary awakening. This is a community circle where we will learn from one another. Everyone's experiences and questionings welcomed. It can be a relief to learn you are not alone with elations and struggles many of us are having right now related to the global shift in consciousness. results.description:
Hello ASL Enthusiasts!

WHAT: ASL Weekly Social
WHEN: EVERY SUNDAY 
TIME: 4:00-6:00PM
WHO: ANYONE is welcome to come by and have a conversation in ASL
WHY: To socialize, have fun, and enjoy chatting in ASL
WHERE:  Potbelly Sandwich Shop behind CVS (on Somerville Ave) 

NOTE: Every once a while, the location may change. PLEASE look on the website each week for confirmation. THANKS!


To get to the Meetup, take the RED LINE stop OUTBOUND TO ALEWIFE, and stop at PORTER SQ. You can easily spot Potbelly Sandwich Shop on side entrance when you arrive at top of escalator at Porter Square Station. If you're driving, you can park on the street for free on Sundays!

Anyone who loves ASL is welcome to come and be part of the fun! We want to warmly extend an invitation to Deaf people or others fluent/skilled in the language (CODAs for example) to join our group.

This is an easy-going, casual, ASL get-together to meet people who enjoy American Sign Language, who want to brush up on their signing skills, and want to learn more ASL by using it as often as possible.

We strive to have a good time and communicate without using voices. If we need to, we draw or write what we don't know how to sign, and if lots of folks show up, we split up into small groups and mix and mingle, so we can actually see one another clearly, face-to-face and get a good conversation going.

Don't be afraid or shy if you're not "perfect" at ASL, because being "perfect" is not the point of this group. No one expects that everyone will be at the same level, and none of us mind slowing down or repeating what we have signed so that everyone understands.

We all laugh WITH one another as we fumble along, mess things up, and start over again. This isn't an ASL class, since none of us are certified ASL teachers, so there's really no pressure or expectation--other than that we all use ASL to communicate. We all learn from one another!

IF you've taken an ASL/Sign Language class before (or have had exposure to someone who uses the language) and know the basics (alphabet, numbers 1-20, and even a small vocabulary of signs ), then join us to get your fingers, hands, face and body moving, ASL-style!

IF you haven't taken an ASL class, or don't know the basics, don't be discouraged ... you can come along anyway and learn by watching, and gradually, participating. We have lots of resources that we can suggest for learning ASL from a qualified teacher or authentic source, such as books, online classes, and local classes at various locations near Boston.

If you can, "officially" RSVP, even if the RSVP is "No," so that we know who is definitely going to come.

It will be great to see folks!

Sean

results.description:
Are you a single woman who's struggling to find true love? Does winning the Powerball jackpot seem more likely than having a happy, fulfilling relationship?  If so, come and share your biggest dating struggles and receive support to get better results in your love life. 

Date With Power is a support group whose mission is to empower single women with the tools, knowledge, and skills they need to find their life partners and create more positive results in their love lives. 

Who Should Attend:

This event is for you if:

• You're a single woman who's seeking a long-term, committed relationship, or


• You're considering getting back into the dating world but have no idea where to begin or what to do, or


• You're open to learning new ideas, strategies, and insights for building and sustaining successful romantic relationships, or

• You've read countless books, articles, and blogs on dating and relationships, but nothing seems to be working.

To Prepare...

Here are a few things to think about:


1. What frustrates you most about dating and relationships?  
2. What does your ideal relationship look like?  What does it feel like?
3.  What might be stopping you from getting there? 

About This Event:

For this, our first meeting, we will meet and greet in an open forum where we frankly discuss our dating and relationship struggles in a supportive, non-judgemental environment.  Once everyone has shared their struggles, we'll do a brief visualization exercise to clarify what our ideal relationship looks and feels like.  We will then discuss what's holding us back from having our ideal relationship, and support each other with ideas and strategies on how to overcome such roadblocks to love.  At the end, we will brainstorm topics for future events. 

About the Leader: 

Erica Chafkin is an emerging leader in PGN who is passionate about empowering women to find their soulmates and to create happier, more successful, romantic relationships. 

After struggling with dating and relationships for over 10 years, Erica embarked on a personal growth journey, studying several gurus, including Tony Robbins, Marni Battista, Christy Whitman, and Joe Amoia. 

She learned to stop playing the role of victim and started to take responsibility for her love life.   She met better quality men, one of whom turned out to be her soulmate and husband-to-be. 

Her dream is to share her knowledge and insight with other women who are struggling to find love.  

The mission of her company, Date With Power (www.datewithpower.com), is to empower women with the solutions, skills, and knowledge that they need to develop happy, fulfilling lifelong relationships with their soulmates.

results.description:
Does the Tinder Flake Factor make you want to quit every dating app and traditional online dating site??  How many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many matches do you make on OKCupid, Match, Tinder or Bumble that never contact you or respond to your messages?

Meet other members for a brief happy hour mingle.  Then you'll be seated for your series of four minute "mini-dates." On your card that you receive at check-in, you'll select who you wish to see again. You can choose Dating or Friendship as your preferred connection.Use this event to make romantic matches as well as meet new friends!


Face to face conversations results in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner and fewer people being blown off.

We will collect everyone's cards at the end of the event and email you your mutual matches within 48 hours.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24 (MUST register with code ATWYS- codes can not be applied after registration)

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: 

http://atwys2016bostonspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS. NO EXCEPTIONS.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

PLEASE REMEMBER:
* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
This is an ongoing weekly (donation only) class for anyone, offering experiential practice in meditation, along with an opportunity to be among others interested in deepening spiritutual practices.  The class provides you with a felt sense of your own divinity; your Higher Self. The meditation, based on Kriya practices,  is partly guided, partly silent. In the guided part we open up to the flow of golden light and energy that is always pouring down to our body/mind/heart and being. Accessing that flow and inviting it to fill us brings a profound level of openness, while washing away limiting thoughts, feelings and beliefs. This higher vibration of unconditional love serves to open our consciousness to new levels of peace, joy and awakening. Bringing the flow of light into the body/mind/heart means we more consciously embody our Light Being, so we are more present, happy, forgiving, peaceful and joyful while in the world.
   After the guided portion we spend time in peaceful silence.  Whether you are an experienced meditator or a beginner, you will love the sweetness and powerful energies of this group. At the end of the class we make time for questions or sharing.  Group meditation is powerful, and it's refreshing to be among fellow travelers!
   Judy also teaches the Sound and Light meditation; a way for you to draw your senses inward to open your spiritual eye and to hear the sounds of your chakras. 
   This practice is non-denominational, appropriate for anyone. 
   Held in a lovely healing space, just walking in will bring you instant peace.  All are welcome.
    You may also want to check out my other Meetup, for a variety of spiritual programs:  http://www.meetup.com/Evolving-Beings/

results.description:
Dude, I love that 25 people are already attending this event before I've written any details or formally announce it to the group. I feel really flattered and grateful for such enthused participation. Keeps me motivated and inspired to host more feasts and swaps. Thank you!

Ok, so now let's get into the yummy stuff. First we swapped cookies (December). Then it was soups (January) and vegetarian chili (February). After that was sauces (March). Since there are two feasts in April, our next swap will be in May, and it will be all about chocolate!


You can pick any recipe you want. Savory or sweet, I don't care. Solid or liquid form, it's your choice. As long as your recipe includes chocolate (or cacao), it automatically qualifies for this month's food swap. Be sure to find a recipe that can easily be packaged into individual portions (see sizing below), and that will travel well.


Whatever inspires you . . . make it, bring it, and swap it!

• • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • 

HERE'S THE SCOOP . . .

1. Pick a Recipe :: Whether it's a family favorite, or one you've ripped out of a magazine  . . . this event is the perfect opportunity for your culinary ideas to shine. NOTE :: Once you know what you want to make, please post it in the comments section. This will help avoid duplication and inspire a better variety of recipes.

2. Storage :: Glass jars, plastic containers, ziplock baggies, boxes, etc . . . Considering what recipe you choose, design your packaging to be portable and swap friendly. For example, if you decide to make Puppy Chow, avoid bringing it in a big bowl. Instead, divvy it up into baggies and carry them with you to the event. Easier to transport and pass out. Make sense?

3. Serving Size :: Aim for 12–16 ounces for each portion (comparable to a jar of jelly). If it's cookies, plan for packages of 6 cookies. For smaller treats, truffles, turtles, etc... I'd suggest 8 pieces per package. Not everyone's items will be the exact same size or weight, but as along as they're close enough, everyone will be happy. NOTE :: Please take a moment to label the containers with the recipe name and packaging date.

4. How Much to Bring? :: Now that we're all on the same page with the serving size, let's discuss how much to bring. Each person is asked to bring a MINIMUM of 8 portions — 7 for swapping + 1 for sampling (the sample doesn't have to be entirely full, just enough for everyone to have a taste). You are welcome to bring more than 8 servings. If you're feeling ambitious—I say go for it! Essentially, whatever amount you bring for swapping, that's the amount of you'll be bringing home. For example, if you bring 10 containers for swapping, you'll leave with 10 different chocolaty foods! NOTE :: Even though 15-20 of us will be coming together for this event, you do NOT have to bring 15-20 servings.

Feeling motivated? If you have the time and can't pick just ONE sauce recipe, feel free to bring TWO recipes for swapping (a minimum of 16 containers you'd be bringing — totally ambitious, yet awesome).


5. Sampling the Food. Have a plate or a bowl with you, so you can put out your food for sampling. I'll have some on hand, along with utensils, just in case. NOTE :: Please bring a list of all the ingredients in your recipe (or copies of your recipe works, too). This will be super helpful for everyone involved.

6. How the Swapping Works :: Though there will be a great variety of recipes for this event, you will NOT be bringing all of them. If you brought 7 containers for swapping, you will be choosing 7 different foods to take home. During the "tasting" portion of the event, you will be making note of which ones you'd like to potentially swap. NOTE :: There's no guarantee you're going to get the exact foods you want. It's up to the other person to decide if they want to take YOUR food home, too. I know, it sounds confusing. I'll explain everything at the event. Trust me . . . it's going to be fun and no one will go home empty-handed!

• • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • •


Complimentary water, tea, and coffee will be available for us to share. I won't bother bringing a dessert for obvious reasons.


Feel free to invite your friends! Even if they are not members of the cookbook club, they are more than welcome to participate in our Food Swap events. Have them follow the directions listed above, and add them as a guest to your RSVP (so we have a head count). Spouses, partners, and such are welcome to join us. The more the merrier, I say.

Comment with any ideas or questions (or future swap ideas).

I hope you can join us!


Warmly,

Jessica

results.description:
Ever heard of Leskov? It turns out, just when you thought you had caught up with all the great dead Russians, they dig up a fresh one. Without him, we might not have had quite the same versions of Chekhov or Bulgakov. And if you are a reader of Walter Benjamin, you might want to look up his fascinating essay on this master.


This collection of stories was written over the course of his writing life, elucidating the very essence of the human condition; themes of love, despair, loneliness, and revenge are explored against the backdrop of nineteenth-century working-class Russia. Leskov deftly layers social satire and subtle criticism atop myth and fable to craft absorbing reads. We will discuss "Lady Macbeth of Mtensk" and "The Enchanted Wanderer."

Also, if you're interested, here is a link to Benjamin's essay:

http://ada.evergreen.edu/~arunc/texts/frankfurt/storyteller.pdf
results.name: Leskov: The Enchanted Wanderer

venue.name: Aberdeen Ave & Huron Ave, Cambridge, MA 02138

results.description:
The oldest, established, permanent floating Community Walk in Cambridge and environs.

Please join the Fresh Pond Community walkers + five other meetup groups for this delightful sunset walk. 

Let's join 20+ walkers and some other walking groups for:

Over 3 years of reliable walking

Please note that this walk does not start at the same place as the other Fresh Pond walk.

We'll go out to dinner at a local pub or chinese restaurant - you can get a decent dinner for under $10.

Frequently, if we eat too much food, we'll go for another walk.

Come see why this walk is so popular. It's at a great time, the people are friendly, the parking is free -- no permit parking in Cambridge on Sunday, so you can park on Huron or Aberdeen Ave.

You can get there by T easily from Harvard Square, take the 71 OR 73 bus to Aberdeen Ave, then walk to the other end of Aberdeen Ave, and you'll see us there. We'll be next to the bridge, on the pond side of Huron Ave,at the intersection of Aberdeen Ave.

If you're late, and we've already started, start walking counter-clockwise. We'll be walking clockwise, so we'll surely bump into each other. We're the large group of vigorously chatting walkers.

Hope to see you there.

Shangri La is located at 149 Belmont Street, Belmont - please let the host know if you're coming, so we can get the right sized table.
results.name: Weekly Multigroup Community Walk at Fresh Pond + dinner at Shangri La 5/22  6:30

results.description:
Join the Fresh Pond Walking Community for our regular Sunday walk around Fresh Pond.   

Let's join regular walkers from surrounding towns + members of five other walking groups and 20+ walkers for this walk.  Walk is on, Rain or Shine.

Few things are more enjoyable than a nice walk and a chat at the end of a busy weekend.

Since May 2012, we've met with a few other meetup groups Let's join for a stroll in a beautiful setting.

We walk clockwise, so if you get there late, just start walking counter-clockwise and you'll run into us.

Parking on Huron Avenue is easy, since the "Permit Parking" rules don't apply on Sunday - just park in any spot on Huron Ave, there will be plenty of them.

If you're coming by bus, take the 71 or 73 bus from Harvard Square and get off at Aberdeen Ave. Walk all the way up Aberdeen until you come to Huron Avenue, we'll be there.

Afterwards, we'll go out for dinner. We usually go for some unusual Chinese food, and the total cost is about $10 per person.

If you have trouble finding us, call me at[masked]

results.description:
Does the Tinder Flake Factor make you want to quit every dating app and traditional online dating site??  How many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many matches do you make on OKCupid, Match, Tinder or Bumble that never contact you or respond to your messages?

Meet other members for a brief happy hour mingle.  Use this time to meet other members. Then you'll be seated for your series of four minute "mini-dates." On your card that you receive at check-in, you'll select who you wish to stay in touch with. You can choose Dating or Friendship as your preferred connection. Everybody you meet at the event is a possible new connection!

We will collect everyone's cards at the end of the event and email you your mutual matches within 48 hours.

While this event is geared towards helping people meet potential romantic matches, you can also mingle with all the guests and find new friends as well. Just write the person's name on your card and check Friendship.

Face to face conversations results in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner and fewer people are blown off.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$24 (MUST register with code ATWYS- codes can not be applied after registration - Look for enter promotional code link in the upper right corner of drop down menu that appears when you click Get Tickets.

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: 

http://atwys2016bostonspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS. NO EXCEPTIONS.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

PLEASE REMEMBER:
* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
There will be stimuli for each meeting to inspire the conversation. The stimuli can be anything, such as a picture, a short story, a breaking news, etc. Each meeting includes member and stimuli introduction, small team and whole group discussion. 

Every attendee is required to raise 1-3 questions inspired by the stimuli. We will discuss why these questions are important; how these questions relate to one's personal life experience; what is one's perspectives on these questions, and how the discussion might affect one's future thinking. 

This is a place to share our souls and learn from others. This is not a place to promote any particular school of thoughts, beliefs, faiths, political views, etc. We must keep an open mind, respect each other, and agree to disagree.
results.how_to_find_us: We will be at the back separate session of the dinning hall, which is accessible from the backdoor towards the parking lot. There will be a sign on the table saying "Soulful Cafe"
results.name: We will enjoy coffee and have a soulful discussion inspired by stimuli

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. results.description:
Intermediate Bluegrass Jam

With a number of our SLOW JAM players getting better, the Dedham School of Music is starting a new INTERMEDIATE Bluegrass Jam the 4th Sunday of every month 7 - 9 pm.

The INTERMEDIATE Bluegrass Jam is intended for players who

• are ready for MORE Bluegrass enjoyment

• know a half dozen (or more!!!) favorite Bluegrass songs or fiddle tunes

• can play those songs by heart (no notes) and (mostly) up to speed

• want to learn more complicated tunes and/or techniques from fellow musicians

At the INTERMEDIATE JAM we expect that you will


• play instrumental breaks on selected bluegrass songs or fiddle tunes

• pick up simpler bluegrass songs by ear or by watching the guitar chord changes

• bring and play traditional Bluegrass songs . . . not blues . . . nor rock . . . nor even Dylan 

NO ADMISSION CHARGE - WE "PASS THE HAT" TO PAY OUR RENT
results.name: NEW - Intermediate Bluegrass Jam 4th Sunday of EVERY month

results.description:
This is an open forum for any PGN member who has questions about PGN.   


It is available to any member of the personal growth community: Heartbeat Salon hosts; brand leaders; potential event leaders; power users; users; and newbies.  It is intended as an extension of the various orientations, but it is open to any questions.

We will:

- answer any questions that are not addressed in the PGN orientations, 
- help implement the orientation suggestions, 
- explore issues that are outside the orientations, 
- and even, repeat answers from the orientations.


Office Hours will be held even if there is only one member signed up.  Generally there is plenty of time for all questions.

The meeting is via Zoom, so you attend via your computer.  This will allow us to share a screen so that you can demonstrate a problem and we can share the solution right there.

Many questions are addressed in our orientations, but if you have questions, this is where you can get them answered.


Click here for our upcoming orientations

results.description:
Join me for this regular monthly Full Moon Labyrinth Walk at the Somerville Growing Center (just outside of Union Square). I offer this outdoor labyrinth walk gathering each month on the Sunday nearest the full moon - April through October.

We'll have a little introduction of walking for those new to labyrinths and some fun discussion about the moon's current astrology and energy we might tap into for reflection or inspiration.

After our contemplative walk, those who wish, may linger for more conversation, community and snacks !
results.how_to_find_us: There's free parking on Vinal Ave. on Sundays. Also not far from the #87 bus along Somerville Ave.

results.description:
Brookline MA
$20 at the door
$5 for students (only if reserved in advance)
Reservations required; email [masked] for reservations and directions.

Claudia Schmidt has been perfecting her craft of performing for almost four decades. It is a quirky and wonderful hodge-podge (her word!) of music, poetry, story, laughter. drama, and celebrating the moment. Work in clubs, theaters, festivals, TV, radio has added depth and dimension, and since she has always included her original work along with very personal versions of the work of others, what you get is a unique look at the world from someone who says what she sees with clarity, humor, and wonder. The San Francisco Bay Guardian said "Schmidt's shows are a lot like falling in love. You never know what's going to happen next, chances are it's going to be wonderful, every moment is burned into your memory and you know you'll never be the same again." More succinctly, Garrison Keiilor said "when Claudia sings a song, it stays sung".

More than 4 decades as a touring professional have found Michigan native Claudia Schmidt traversing North America as well as Europe in venues ranging from intimate clubs to 4,000 seat theatres, and festival stages in front of 25,000 rapt listeners. She has recorded nineteen albums of mostly original songs, exploring folk, blues, and jazz idioms featuring her acclaimed 12-string guitar and mountain dulcimer playing.
results.name: Claudia Schmidt House Concert

results.description:
Strange game last night following two pretty dominant efforts by the pens. They're headed home tomorrow night though and will be looking to get back on track, most likely with MAF back in goal where he belongs. And if that's not enough, the heart break kid himself is apparently going to be in the barn for this one (pittsburgh's obsession with pro wrestling always did sort of confuse me if we're being honest)

Anyhow, we're going to venture out to another new bar, this time in Somerville. We'll be at Tony Cs in Assembly Row, a gorgeous and enormous new sports bar on the banks of the mystic river. Parking is free and there's also an orange line stop so no excuse not to get your butt out for this one! See everyone tomorrow!

As always, please RSVP if you plan on attending.

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball. 

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.
results.name: Monday Lunchtime Soccer (OUTDOOR)

results.description:
Let's go for a brisk hike in the the Fells. We plan to hike 3 to 5 miles, approx 1.5-2 hours. The route is TBD and may include steep or rough terrain.


*This is a fitness hike rather than a stroll in the woods.* To keep pace with the group, you should be able to walk a 3 mile per hour pace on the trail (which is significantly slower than walking on the road.)


You will need to wear good trail shoes and layers to adjust for temperature change. We will meet at the Long Pond parking area on South Border Rd off Mystic Valley Pkway. Arrive a few minutes early - we leave promptly at 5:15pm.


http://www.getupngoadventures.com/html/south_border_road.html

Random Group of Hikers Disclaimer

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow theHike Safe Responsibility Code; the organizer(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you release, hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.

results.description:
Hi everyone. Join our next meetup on Monday, May 23 at 438 Somerville Ave in Somerville (in the alley at the back of the Market Basket parking lot.)


We will give a brief presentation on why yoga breathing is so beneficial. Then Amy Coleman will guide us through an hour-long class that will provide an opportunity to work on your breathing technique. Here are the schedule and other specifics:


5:30 - Show up any time between 5:30 - 6:00, ideally dressed for yoga. Otherwise, there is a bathroom where you can change. If the door isn't open, try the bell or call me at[masked], and someone will come get you. Here is a picture of the recently painted door:


6:00 - Presentation on what we can accomplish through "yoga breathing."

6:15 - One hour yoga class begins. We provide a floor and an instructor, but please bring anything else you need (mat, water, blocks, strap, blanket etc.) If it is your first time, you will also need to sign a waiver before the class begins.


7:15 - Enjoy a beverage and mingle.
results.name: Yoga and the science of breathing

results.description:
n every corner of the world, random people post personal video clips online. Most clips flounder in a sad limbo of indifference and anonymity—unless your YouTube handle happens to be Princess Shaw. By day, Samantha Montgomery cares for the elderly in one of New Orleans's toughest neighborhoods. By night, she writes and sings her own songs as Princess Shaw, belting out soulful originals and posting a cappella clips on YouTube, usually reaching just a handful of viewers. Raw and vulnerable, her voice is a diamond in the rough. Across the globe, Ophir Kutiel, better known as Kutiman, is an Israeli musician living on a kibbutz outside Tel Aviv who mashes up YouTube videos from all over the world to create new musical pieces. Princess Shaw has no idea that he has found hers. Two strangers, almost 7,000 miles apart, begin to build a song. The film unfolds as Kutiman pairs Princess Shaw's emotional performances in a beautiful expression of generosity and compassion, revealing the bona fide star underneath and her fight to never give up on her dreams.

PRESENTING PRINCESS SHAW opens Friday, June 3 at Landmark's Kendall Square Cinema. The film's running time is 80 minutes and it is Rated R. https://youtu.be/dyUmgkv9leQ
results.name: Princess Shaw   5-23   Mon.    Kendall Sq.  7 PM

results.description:
A massive wildfire has swept through northeastern Alberta and most notably through the town of Fort McMurray. More than 80,000 people have been evacuated and more than 2500 structures have been destroyed. Along with our partner, the Consulate General of Canada in Boston, a fundraiser to benefit the Fort McMurray Residents has been organized.

Join your fellow Canadians (and concerned Americans) for a Victoria Day fundraiser to benefit those who have been affected by this devastating event.

100% of the proceeds from the event will be donated to the Canadian Red Cross.

Suggested $10 donation at the door

Great list of Raffle items at the event:

· Chef’s table experience at Earls Restaurant
· Brad Marchand autographed puck
· Snowboard and bag
· 2 tickets to the June 3rd Red Sox vs. Blue Jays game
· Bruins Gift Bag
· After Work Pool Party from Jillians for up to 20 people
· Duck tour/trolley tickets for 4 people
· Human Preservation Co - $50 gift certificate
· The Fours - $30 gift certificate
· City Streets Restaurant - $25 gift certificate
· Jake and Joes Sports Bar – $25 gift certificate
· Joe Sent Me - $25 gift certificate
· Joe Sent Me - $25 gift certificate

Raffle tickets available, $3 each, 2 for $5, 5 for $10
