results.description:
Wanna try us out? Come join us at our water training sessions! No prior experience necessary. 

• First two practices are $10 (The $10 can go towards the full membership of $110 for the rest of the season). Pay via Paypal ("Boston 1 - Join us") or venmo (@boston1dboat).</a>

• Also you will not be allowed on the boats if you do not sign the waiver: <a href="https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1Ll2NR3MZbV3O7ZrmPdZsCbKRaC_G8KKa7lwBUlC59Pk/viewform?c=0&w=1">"Boston 1 e-waiver" 

• Make sure to check our Facebook,</a><a href="http://bit.ly/Boston1facebook">http://bit.ly/Boston1facebook for practice announcements and cancellations -- especially in the early and later parts of season with potentially colder night practices. 

Weekly practices are every Monday, Wednesday and Saturday unless a race is scheduled or practice is cancelled.

Mon & Wed: 5:45pm - 8pm, meet 5.45pm on the grassy patch near the Barking Crab. 
Sat: 10:45am - 1pm, meet 10.45am on the grassy patch near the Barking Crab.

Optional dinner/lunch or social activity afterwards!

Outdoor paddling means exposure to the weather and water! Be prepared to get wet!

• Clothing: Wear workout clothes, synthetic fibers that dry quickly are highly recommended. Bring dry clothes to change into afterwards. 

• Footwear: Sandals or flip flops recommended. Some people go barefoot. Shoes and socks are not recommended. 

• Other: Bring plenty of water and sunscreen. Expensive glasses or sunglasses are not recommended. 

All paddling equipment is provided (paddles, pfds). Locked locker provided on-site. Please bring as little as possible to practice as space is limited.

In the event of inclement weather, announcements will be made through the comments area of each meetup event, also in Twitter, Facebook and email alerts.

Sign up for our weekly emails and email alerts

Twitter: @Boston1Dboat

Facebook: http://bit.ly/Boston1facebook

Parking: Channelside Parking at 284 A Street. Enter at 29-41 Necco Street, off Melcher Street. Weekend $5 flat rate. Weekdays $8 flat rate (in after 3pm). More details can be found here: http://bit.ly/1Nxv1lw.

Restroom: Do not use the restrooms in the Barking Crab, use the public restrooms near the Daily Catch

Public Transport: Closest T stop is South Station on the red line.

Hope to see you there!
results.name: Monday Water training

results.description:
~ Register for free here http://ga.co/1TtHt7Y ~

In[masked] we have seen a rise of organizations dedicated to increasing the number of Women in STEM. We are seeing progress, but there are a handful of factors that can impact a women's success in the space.

The truth is, Women who enter the computer science field following graduation leave it at an alarming rate of 56% within the first decade of their career. “Women with STEM higher education degrees are twice as likely to leave a scientific or engineering job as men with comparable STEM degrees.” This figure is not only attributed to lower pay compared to that of male colleagues, but a work culture that has been described as hostile to women.

At this event, General Assembly + ChickTech are coming together to tackle Impostor Syndrome, which is a persistent fear that can alter a person's perceptions of themselves and the quality of their work. Impostor syndrome is a common symptom of this hostile culture women often face in STEM. For some it is a lingering feeling of anxiety, for others it can be debilitating.

Don't let the environment bring you down! Learn to recognize the symptoms and pick up a few tips to help combat impostor syndrome as you break into tech.

Tickets: FREE
Register at General Assembly
results.how_to_find_us: take the elevator to the basement
results.name: Don't Just Lean In, SPEAK UP! Overcoming Impostor Syndrome

results.description:
Even though Guitar and Keyboards are not "Rhythm" instruments, what role does Rhythm play in your music. What if you switched up your sense of Rhythm or were more conscious of it as a tool to use as a springboard to add dimension to your writing. Sometimes we fall into a rhythm rut. We may use the same tempo and or rely on the same underlying rhythms when writing. We write a song with a slower tempo when maybe the tempo could or might be more effective quicker. Maybe the tempo could tie into something in your lyrics or relate to the title. For instance you would probably not write a ballad called "All revved up" How do you decide these things?

Let's talk about it!

Ellen 😀
results.how_to_find_us: Highland Ave to Valley Street. 1st right onto Cherry Hill Ave. 3rd house on the left.
results.name: Rhythm and Tempo

results.description:
Ünterbar Comedy Showcase and Open Mic returns to Thunderbar Comedy, it's comedic mad science! Comedians looking to remain unchallenged by the perils of changing up their material need not apply. The show starts with a hour of booked comics, each doing their sets while trying to complete a series of random tasks without the audience knowing. Owen Linders will be hosting a lineup of improvisational standup warlords including Francesca Villa, Mark Gallagher, Chris Kaufman, Shaun Connolly, Nick Chambers and Thom Crowley!

The open mic follows with Brandon Vallee and Casey Crawford hosting a mic based around the beloved German Comedic past-time known as Tarnkappe (We studied abroad, just go with it). Go on stage and do your planned routine OR feel free to pluck from the beloved Tarnkappe (Magic Hat) and riff on prompts written by other comics and audience members alike! Kill it at the Tarnkappe and you could win 10 bucks and a spot on the next ThunderBar mic!

List at 6, show starts at 6:30, mic starts after with 4 Min Spots! Expand your horizons!
results.name: UnterBar Comedy Showcase!

group.name: Boston-area Comedy Lovers - Comedy shows for free (or cheap)

results.description:
Come draw in a pleasant, cafe environment.

Many people like to draw but don't take the time or can't think of what to draw. Our goal is to create an atmosphere that is both inspiring to drawing as well as fun and social. 

We hope that both those skilled at drawing and those aspiring to be able to draw will join us. Adults, teens and children accompanied by an adult or teen are welcome.

Thanks to Three Stones Gallery in West Concord there will be art materials to work with, including colored pencils, cray pas, crayons, graphite pencils, watercolors and brushes as well as papers. 

Lots of possibilities of things to draw, including still lives, yourself in a mirror and other people drawing. There will also be stationary for those who would like to make greeting cards for "The Welcome Project", a fund-raiser for Dignity in Asylum. DIAS is a local organization that provides housing and community support in the Concord area for people who had fled persecution in their home countries.

Just for fun, we will have door prizes, given out at 8:00. 

Around 7:00, if people are into the idea we will have a drawing game, probably "Monster Scribbles". 

Hope to see you there!

Margot
results.how_to_find_us: The Bakery is in the red brick warehouse next to the Citgo gas station, at the corner of Commonwealth and Laws Brook Road.
results.name: Drawing Jam!!

results.description:
Free. Fun. Starts here!

Welcome to the Marlborough Couch to 5K sponsored by ConnectingPoint Church. We love people in our community. We've helped over 400 people get off the couch and start jogging!


We have 2 groups: 

 1. Our Jogging Group has a goal of jogging a 5K. 

 2. Our Alumni Jogging Group has a goal of keep jogging for those who have jogged at least once season with us. 

We introduce people to jogging and getting fit. The program gradually moves you from walking at your own pace to jogging at your own pace. 

• FREE 10-week program to get you from the couch to running a 5K (3.1 miles) 

• Anyone from the community can participate

• Led by experienced runners 

• Monday through Thursdays 6pm-6:45pm; Sundays 8am-8:45am, with a goal of joining us 3 of these sessions per week 

• 45 minute time commitment

• Goal of jogging and finishing the Sprit of Hudson 5K in June 

Encourage those you love to get “off the couch” and join you in the great sport of running. Come have some fun! Bring a water bottle and join the group. 

Please arrive 15 minutes early the first night, so we can explain what you'll be doing on the Rail Trail, stretching out, etc.


 Please consult your doctor if you have a health or medical condition that prevents you from exercising. 

For more information please visit http://www.connectingpointchurch.org/couchto5k/

https://youtu.be/OndSmceU9R4
results.how_to_find_us: Park in the unpaved municipal parking lot to the left of 72 Jefferson Street
results.name: Marlborough Couch to 5K - Spring 2016

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
